lines.value: baltimore is the biggest city in the us state of maryland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2010 it had about 620961 people living there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is not in any county so it is called an independent city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is next to the chesapeake bay and used to be an important port for trade by ships
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is still some shipping but the inner harbor is now mostly famous for shopping and restaurants and also for the national aquarium and other museums
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: baltimore is home to the ravens football and orioles baseball both professional sports teams
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its main newspaper is the baltimore sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a place for horse races in the city called pimlico
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many colleges and universities in baltimore like johns hopkins university
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city was made in 1729 and is named after the british lord baltimore who started the colony of maryland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mayor of this city is stephanie rawlings blake
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is the second woman to be the mayor of baltimore the first was sheila dixon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many governors of maryland were mayor of baltimore first
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one famous thing that happened in baltimore was in the war of 1812 when the british attacked the city and francis scott key wrote a song about it called the star spangled banner
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is now the national song of the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some famous people from baltimore are the supreme court judge thurgood marshall the poet and writer edgar allen poe the baseball player babe ruth the singer billie holiday and the movie director john waters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1706 the colony of maryland's general assembly created the port of baltimore at locust point
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was built for tobacco trading
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the town of baltimore was founded on july 30 1729
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was named after cecilius calvert the british lord baltimore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: calvert was the first proprietary governor of the province of maryland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: baltimore grew quickly in the 1700s as a granary place for storing cereals and grains for the sugar plantations in the caribbean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: baltimore was important in the time leading up to the american revolution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: leaders like jonathan plowman jr got the city to refuse to pay taxes to britain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: merchants people who buy and sell things signed agreements to not trade with britain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second continental congress met in the henry fite house from december 1776 to february 1777
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this made baltimore the capitol of the united states during this time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1796 after the war the town of baltimore nearby jonestown and an area called fells point were as the city of baltimore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that these areas all merged and became the city of baltimore the city was a part of baltimore county until 1851
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it then became an independent city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the war of 1812 the battle of baltimore happened in the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the british attacked baltimore on the night of september 13 1814
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was right after they burned washington dc united states soldiers from fort mchenry defended the inner harbor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: francis scott key watched the battle from a british ship in the harbor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote the poem the star spangled banner about the attack
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later the star spangled banner became the official national anthem of the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the war the number of people who lived in the city grew quickly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the national road now part of us route 40 and the baltimore and ohio railroad b&o connected the city with big markets in the midwest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this made baltimore a very important shipping and manufacturing center
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: baltimore was nicknamed the monumental city by president john quincy adams in 1827
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during an event adams gave a toast and said baltimore the monumental city - [m]ay the days of her safety be as prosperous and happy as the days of her dangers have been trying and triumphant in 1835 the baltimore bank riots happened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these were one of the worst riots of the antebellum south
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the antebellum period is the time right before the american civil war during the american civil war maryland did not secede from the union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is maryland stayed a part of the union and did not join the confederacy when union soldiers marched through the city at the start of the war some people attacked the soldiers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this started the baltimore riot of 1861
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: four soldiers and 12 civilians were killed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the riot union soldiers occupied stayed in baltimore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the war maryland was governed directly by the federal government and the state government did not have any power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was to keep the state from seceding leaving the union
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the war ended in april 1865 maryland began governing itself again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the 1870s there was an economic depression called the panic of 1873 after the panic the baltimore & ohio railroad company decided to pay its workers less
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this caused the great railroad strike of 1877
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these strikes stopped train service in cumberland in western maryland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on july 20 1877 the maryland governor john lee carroll ordered the maryland army national guard to stop the strikes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people who supported the railroad workers attacked the national guard soldiers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soldiers from the 6th regiment fired their guns at the crowd
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 10 people were killed and 25 people were hurt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this started a riot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: trains were damaged and parts of camden station were burned
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: us army soldiers came to baltimore to protect the railroad and end the strike
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the riot and strike ended on july 21 22 1877
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fire caused about $150 million of damage us$ million in 2018 the city grew bigger by annexing absorbing suburbs from nearby counties

lines.value: guinness world records is a reference book published each year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a collection of world records both human achievements and the extremes of the natural world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the book itself holds a world record as the best selling copyrighted book series of all time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also one of the most often stolen books from public libraries in the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was known until 2000 as the guinness book of records and in previous us editions as the guinness book of world records
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 4 may 1951 sir hugh beaver who then worked for guinness breweries went on a shooting party by the river slaney in county wexford ireland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became involved in an argument over which game bird in europe was the fastest the koshin golden plover or the grouse
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that evening at castlebridge house he realised that it was impossible to confirm in reference books whether or not the golden plover was europe's fastest game bird
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: beaver knew that there must be many other questions debated nightly in pubs throughout ireland but there was no book in the world to settle arguments about records
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he realised then that a book with the answers to this sort of question might prove popular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: norris and ross mcwhirter were asked to put the book together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they ran a fact finding agency in london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in august 1954 the first book was made
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one thousand copies were printed and given away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first 197-page edition was bound on 27 august 1955
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it went to the top of the british bestseller lists by christmas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following year it went to the us and it sold 70000 copies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the book was very popular and the company decided to make one updated edition each year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they published in october to go with christmas sales
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: recent editions have focused on record feats by human competitors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: competitions go from obvious ones such as weightlifting to the longest egg tossing distance or for longest time spent playing grand theft auto iv or the number of hot dogs that can be eaten in ten minutes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eating contests and beer and alcohol consumption entries are no longer accepted possibly for fear of litigation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: besides records about competitions it has such facts as the heaviest tumor the most poisonous plant the shortest river roe river the longest running drama guiding light in the usa the longest serving members of a drama series william roache for coronation street in the uk ray meagher for home and away in australia and the world's most successful salesman joe girard among others
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each edition has a selection of the large set of records in the guinness database
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ways used to make that choice have changed over the years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the newest records are added and the records that have been updated are added too
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is to encourage breaking of world records

lines.value: a minister is a member of parliament who has a special role dealing with a certain area of government

lines.value: minister for children the minister for children looks after children's rights these are laws which take care of how children are treated by their parents or guardians a guardian is someone who looks after a child when their parents are not able to and their care in society

lines.value: the job means that this minister has a special role in the lives of all children in the uk

lines.value: they also take care of broadcasting laws and laws about what newspapers and television stations can and cannot do

lines.value: it also has a flag with a red background and 3 armoured legs joined together whichever way you throw us we always land on our feet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a parliament called tynwald
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the longest running parliament in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isle of man is a crown dependency
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: foreign affairs defence and good government are handled by the british government but in all other matters the island is independent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isle of man government is the executive and proposes laws to the legislature tynwald
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: laws passed by tynwald are given royal approval by the lieutenant governor unless the british minister of justice says they do not help the good government of the island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isle of man is an island in the irish sea it is northwest of the european continent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is between the united kingdom and ireland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the island is 22 km wide and 52 km long it has a total area of 572 kmÂ²
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isle of man has a total of 160 km of coastline it has no important bodies of water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: apart from the island itself the isle of man also includes some nearby islands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most important of these islands are called calf of man st patrick's isle and st michael's isle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the island's terrain is varied it has mountains in the north and south
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a valley is more or less in the center of the island between the cities of douglas and peel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the northern part of the island is very flat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: snaefell is the isle of man's highest mountain it measures 621 meters above sea level
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is said that you can see scotland england ireland and wales from the top of mount snaefell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isle of man has a usually mild weather
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: summers are cool and winters are mild and rainy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rainfall is similar to that of the other british isles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: elevated parts of the isle of man get more rainfall especially mount snaefell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the northern and southern parts of the island are not as rainy as the rest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the island's weather is normally cool
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the highest temperature ever registered is 28.9 Â°c in ronaldsway
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isle of man is not very sunny but it is less cloudy than other parts of the british isles strong winds around the island help keep clouds in constant movement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the geology of man is notable for the iapetus suture which runs almost unseen right through the rocks of the island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the suture is the remnant of a once huge ocean the iapetus ocean which was lost about 420 million years ago as three continents came together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isle of man became separated from ireland and the british isles about 8500 years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the short period of time between the melting of glaciers and the rise of sea level allowed a small number of species to colonize the island by land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the island was heavily deforested in the middle ages which weakened its environment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some land is now protected by the government to help preserve its wildlife
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: curraghs wildlife park in the wetlands is home to many species of animals and plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the island is also home to a large number of bird species
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a lot of the isle of man's plant life or flora is composed of shrubs bushes and other short plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: several species of grass and moss also live there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mosses on the island contribute to the formation of peat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is peat in the island's wet areas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the island has heavily deforested in the middle ages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: common trees on the island include ashes elms pines willows and hawthorns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are also other trees on the island as well as many species of flowering plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bogs are home to ferns and orchids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isle of man is home to a large number of bird and insect species
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many species live in curraghs wetlands in the northeast of the island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: curraghs are protected by the government of the isle of man
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: curraghs wildlife park is in these wetlands it is both a zoo and a protected area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the winter curraghs are the second largest nesting ground of the hen herrier in europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the peregrine falcon merlin european robin willow warbler song thrush dunnock swan and a subspecies of winter wren possibly native to the island also nest in the curraghs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chough is also in the isle of man it is more common than in other parts of europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some farming methods have decreased the bird population of the island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the northern lapwing is now rarely found and the yellowhammer is now extinct on the island
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 18 species of butterfly and 250 species of moth also live on the isle of man
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of them live in the wetlands during different seasons

lines.value: a eukaryote is an organism with complex cells or a single cell with a complex structures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in these cells the genetic material is organized into chromosomes in the cell nucleus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: animals plants algae and fungi are all eukaryotes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are also eukaryotes amongst single celled protists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in contrast simpler organisms such as bacteria and archaea do not have nuclei and other complex cell structures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: such organisms are called prokaryotes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eukaryotes are often treated as a superkingdom or domain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eukaryotes evolved in the proterozoic eon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oldest known probable eukaryote is grypania a coiled unbranched filament up to 30mm long
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oldest grypania fossils come from an iron mine near negaunee michigan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fossils were originally dated as 2100 million years ago but later research showed the date as about 1874 million years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: grypania lasted into the mesoproterozoic era
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another ancient group is the acritarchs believed to be the cysts or reproductive stages of algal plankton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are found 1400 million years ago in the mesoproterozoic era
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: p57 the classification of the eukaryota is under active discussion and several taxonomies have been proposed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all modern versions have five kingdoms but disagree about which groups go into each kingdom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eukaryotic cells are usually much bigger than prokaryotes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they can be up to 10 times bigger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eukaryote cells have many different internal membranes and structures called organelles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also have a cytoskeleton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cytoskeleton is made up of microtubules and microfilaments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: those parts are very important in the cell's shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eukaryotic dna is put in bundles called chromosomes which are separated by a microtubular spindle during cell division
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most eukaryotes have some sort of sexual reproduction through fertilisation which prokaryotes do not use
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: prokaryotes do not have sexes but they can pass dna to other bacteria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their cell division is asexual
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bacterial conjugation is when bacteria give each dna by touching each other or making something like a bridge to go between them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eukaryotes have sets of linear chromosomes located in the nucleus and the number of chromosomes is usually typical for each species
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in eukaryotic cells there are many things with membranes around them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all of them together are called the endomembrane system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: simple bags called vesicles or vacuoles are sometimes made by budding off other membranes just like how children make bubbles with their toys
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many cells take in food and other things using something called endocytosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in endocytosis the membrane closest to the outside bends inwards and then pinches off to make a vesicle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many other organelles that have membranes probably started off as vesicles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nucleus is surrounded by two membranes membrane that has holes in it so things can go in and out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nuclear envelope has things sticking out of it that look like tubes and sheets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are called the endoplasmic reticulum which is often shortened to er
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the er is works with moving proteins around and allowing them to mature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the er has two parts the rough er and the smooth er
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rough er has ribosomes attached to it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the proteins made by the ribosomes attached to the rough er go to the inside the rough er called the lumen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after that they usually go into vesicles which grow and pinch off from the smooth er
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in most eukaryotes the vesicles with proteins inside fuse with piles of flattened vesicles called the golgi bodies where the proteins inside are changed again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vesicles are sometimes changed so they can do one thing very well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called specialization or differentiation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example lysosomes have enzymes inside them that break down the food the comes from food vacuoles and peroxisomes have enzymes that break down peroxide a poison so it is not poisonous anymore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many protozoa have contractile vacuoles which are vacuoles that can fuse or pinch off from the outer membrane
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: contractile vesicles are often used to get and get rid of unneeded water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: extrusomes shoot out stuff that make predators go away or catch food
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in multicellular organisms hormones are often made in vesicles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the complicated plants most of the inside of a plant cell is taken up by a central vacuole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that central vacuole is the main thing that keeps osmotic pressure so the cell can hold its shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because the cell organelles of eukaryotes have different polyphyletic origins the question arises as to whether the group is a unified clade or not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is certain that the protists are not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cell organelles are specialised units which carry out well defined functions like mitochondria and plastids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is fairly clear now that all or most of these organelles have their origin in once independent prokaryotes bacteria or archaea and that the eukaryote cell is a community of micro organisms working together in a marriage of convenience
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first such events took place between ancient bacteria to produce the double membrane class known as gram negative bacteria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the gram negative bacteria include the cyanobacteria this was the first of several such events in the history of the eukaryotes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: protista is a group of different single celled organisms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more accurate taxonomies have been proposed but scientists are still discussing them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for this reason protista is still useful for talking about these organisms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one modern scheme for the classification of the eukarya is as follows however in 2005 doubts were expressed as to whether some of these supergroups were monophyletic particularly the chromalveolata and a review in 2006 noted the lack of evidence for several of the supposed six supergroups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the eukarya may only be unified in the sense that the cells are a community derived from bacteria and archaea opinions vary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like the protista the eukarya may be a polyphyletic assembly though a useful one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however as mentioned above all branches of the eukarya have sexual reproduction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that and the general organisation of the nucleus are the defining features
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these two points are the main evidence for monophyletic origin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the great barrier reef is the world's largest coral reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is close to the coast of queensland australia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is made up of nearly 3000 coral reefs and over 600 islands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is 327800 kmÂ² big and 2600 km long
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has been listed an important world heritage site by unesco
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the great barrier reef is the largest structure made by living things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be seen from outer space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reefs are threatened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the biggest threat to the great barrier reef today is coral bleaching caused by high sea water temperatures as a result of global warming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during 2016 the worst die off ever recorded occured due to seas warming around the great barrier reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two thirds of a 700-km 435 miles stretch of coral in nine months were killed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reef research centre has found the remains of coral that are half a million years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: corals have been growing in the region for as long as 25 million years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the corals have not always formed coral reefs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is difficult to work out the age of the great barrier reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because of the way a reef can grow and shrink as the sea level changes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a coral reef can grow in diameter that is how wide they are from 1 to 2 cm per year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they can also grow upwards from 1 to 15 cm per year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coral can not grow if the water is too deep 150 metres or more because it needs light from the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they cannot grow out of the water above sea level
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the great barrier reef marine park authority and australian institute of marine science say the current living reef started growing about 20000 years ago
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it started to grow on an older reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes the beginning of the reef duringay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the land that forms the bottom of the great barrier reef was a coastal plain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the plain had some large hills
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of these hills were parts of older reefs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from 20000 years ago until 6000 years the sea level began to rise
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as it rose the corals could grow higher on the hills of the coastal plain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 13000 years ago the sea level was 60 metres lower than the present day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: corals began to grow around the hills of the coastal plain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these became continental islands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the sea level rose higher most of these continental islands were covered by water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the corals could then grow over the hills
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this formed the present cays and reefs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sea level on the great barrier reef has not risen much in the last 6000 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the crc reef research centre has worked out that the present living reef is 6000 to 8000 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the remains of a very old barrier reef has been found in the kimberley area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is in the northern part of western australia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the great barrier reef world heritage area has been divided into 70 different areas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are called bioregions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each bioregion has its own special plants and animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are 30 reef bioregions and 40 are non reef bioregions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the northern part of the great barrier reef there are ribbon reefs and deltaic reefs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these kinds of reef do not exist in the rest of the great barrier reef system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the great barrier reef has 1500 species of fish and many other animals algae and corals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes many vulnerable or endangered species
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of these exist only on this reef system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thirty species of whales dolphins and porpoises have been seen in the great barrier reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes the dwarf minke whale indo pacific humpback dolphin and the humpback whale
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the population of the dugongs live there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: six species of sea turtles come to the reef to breed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are the green sea turtle leatherback sea turtle hawksbill turtle loggerhead sea turtle flatback turtle and the olive ridley
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two different groups of green sea turtles on the great barrier reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one group lives in the northern part of the reef and the other in the south
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fifteen species of seagrass attract the dugongs and turtles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also provide a food and shelter for fish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most common kinds of seagrasses are halophila and halodule
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saltwater crocodiles live in mangrove and salt marshes on the coast near the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no crocodile nests have been found on the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the salt water crocodiles on the reef travel long distances
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are not many living around the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: around 125 species of shark stingray skates or chimaera live on the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 5000 species of mollusc live on the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include the giant clam nudibranchs and cone snails
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: forty nine species of pipefish and nine species of seahorse have been found
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: seven species of frogs live on the islands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also the moray eel lives on the bottom preying on fish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 215 species of birds come to the reef or nest or roost on the islands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes 22 species of seabirds and 32 species of shorebirds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include the white bellied sea eagle and roseate tern
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most nesting sites are on islands in the northern and southern regions of the great barrier reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 1.7 million birds use the sites to breed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the islands of the great barrier reef have 2195 known plant species
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three of these do not live anywhere else
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the northern islands have 300-350 plants which are woody
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the southern islands have 200 plants which are herbaceous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the whitsunday region has the most plant species placing at 1141
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the plant species are mostly spread by fish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: seventeen types of sea snake live on the great barrier reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they take about 4 years to become old enough to breed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they usually live on the sea floor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they live in warm waters up to deep
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are more common in the southern part of the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more than 1500 species of fish live on the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include the clownfish red bass redthroat emperor and several types of snapper and coral trout
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are at least 330 species of sea squirts ascidians on the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these vary in size from 1 mm 10 cm in diameter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between 300-500 species of bryozoans live on the reef system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are small water animals that look like moss or branches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: four hundred species of corals both hard corals and soft corals live on the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of these spawn releasing thousands of eggs in huge events
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this spawning is controlled by the rising sea temperatures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this happens in spring summer and some parts of autumn as part of the moons lunar cycle and the day night diurnal cycle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: reefs in the inner great barrier reef spawn during the week after the full moon in october
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: outer reefs spawn in november and december
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the common soft corals on the great barrier reef belong to 36 different types
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: five hundred species of marine algae or seaweed live on the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes thirteen types of halimeda
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these deposit chalky calcareous mounds up to 100 metres wide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have mini ecosystems on their surface which have been compared to rainforest cover
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a new report the reef outlook report says that climate change will cause huge damage to the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the report was written by the great barrier reef marine park authority
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: warmer and more acidic water around the coral reef will slow down calcification which is how the coral grows and becomes strong
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the corals will become bleached lose their colours and many species that live on and around the reef will be in danger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the australian government has already spent au$325 million to improve the health of the reef in the last two years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reef outlook report also warned of other dangers to the reef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these included poor quality water running into the sea from the mainland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this water is polluted with farm insecticides and rubbish from nearby towns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the increasing amount of development on the coast is destroying natural marine and coastal habitats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is also some damage from fishing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: benzene also known as benzol is an organic chemical compound with the formula c 6 h 6
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a colorless and flammable liquid with a sweet smell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: benzene molecules are a ring of six carbon atoms that are each bonded to one hydrogen atom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is an aromatic compound meaning the ring has alternating double bonds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: benzene is carcinogenic which means it can cause cancer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has many real world uses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is used as an additive in gasoline plastics synthetic rubber dyes and it is an industrial solvent which means it can dissolve many other chemical molecules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: benzene is also a natural part of crude oil and is therefore present in gasoline
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many medicines contain parts made from benzene
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: benzene has special properties called aromaticity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all six carbon atoms in the ring are on the same flat plane
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to account for all the bonds on a six carbon ring there must be alternating double carbon bonds conjugated system if benzene had three double bonds three sides of its ring would be shorter than the other three sides
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: x ray diffraction shows that all of six carbon carbon bonds in benzene are of the same length of 140 picometres pm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the c c bond lengths are greater than a double bond 135 pm but shorter than a single bond 147 pm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this intermediate distance is consistent with electron delocalization the electrons for c c bonding are distributed equally between each of the six carbon atoms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the molecule is planar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one representation is that the structure exists as a superposition of so called resonance structures rather than either form individually
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in other words the molecule's double bonds switch quickly between pairs of carbon atoms the delocalization of electrons is one explanation for the thermodynamic stability of benzene and related aromatic compounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is likely that this stability contributes to the peculiar molecular and chemical properties known as aromaticity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to indicate the delocalized nature of the bonding benzene is often depicted with a circle inside a hexagonal arrangement of carbon atoms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as is common in organic chemistry the carbon atoms in the diagram above have been left unlabeled
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: realizing each carbon has 2p electrons each carbon donates an electron into the delocalized ring above and below the benzene ring
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the overlap of p orbitals both above and below the ring that produces the pi clouds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1986 some chemists the delocalized view of benzene in an article in the journal nature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they showed that the electrons in benzene are almost certainly localized to particular carbon atoms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they showed the aromatic properties of benzene come from spin coupling rather than electron delocalization
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other scientists wrote articles to support this view in nature in 1987
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but chemists are slow to switch from the delocalized electrons view
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sunlight is the light and energy that comes from the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when this energy reaches the earth's surface it is called insolation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: what we experience as sunlight is actually solar radiation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the radiation and heat from the sun in the form of electromagnetic waves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the atmosphere affects the amount of solar radiation received
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when solar radiation travels through the atmosphere some of it is absorbed by the atmosphere 16%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of it is scattered to space 6%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of it is reflected by clouds 28%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 47% of it reaches the earth's surface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: without sunlight there could be no life on earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plants need sunlight for the process of photosynthesis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during photosynthesis the plants use the energy of the sunlight water and carbon dioxide to create glucose sugar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the glucose can later be used by the plant for energy or animals eat the plant and the glucose in it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plants need sunlight to grow green
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: without enough sunlight but with enough water the plant grows very tall very quickly but looks yellow and dehydrated although when touched the leaves are very moist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: solar radiation can be both good and bad for a person's health
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when in the light the human body uses the ultraviolet part of sunlight to make its own vitamin d without sunscreen too much ultraviolet light can cause sunburn and skin cancer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sun angle makes difference in seasons on earth as well as in the length of day and night
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a high angle makes the tropics hot and a low angle makes the arctic cold
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: different bodies of the solar system receive sunlight of different intensities

lines.value: the table compares the amount of light received by each planet on the solar system follows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: solar energy is used in many different ways by people all over the world both in its traditional way for heating cooking or drying and to make electricity where other power supplies are absent such as in remote places on earth or in the space
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes it is cheaper to make electricity from sunlight than from coal or oil

lines.value: fenrir was tied up by the gods but was destined to grow too big for his bonds and eats odin during ragnarok
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after killing odin he is killed by odin's son vioarr
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: fenrir has two sons hati hate and skoll
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he has a brother jormungandr the midgard serpent and a sister hel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: odin found out about a prophecy that the children of loki and angora would cause trouble for the gods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had fenrir brought to him along with its brother jormungandr and its sister hel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after throwing jormungandr into the sea and sending hel into the land of the dead odin had the wolf raised among the asir only the god tyr was brave enough to feed the growing monster

lines.value: the wolf got stronger and stronger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the gods were scared that he would eventually destroy them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they tried to chain it up

lines.value: he agreed to be chained two times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both times he easily broke the chains

lines.value: odin had the dwarfs make the chain gleipnir deceiver or entangler
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it looked like a silken ribbon but was made of six magical ingredients the sound of a cat's step the beard of a woman the roots of a mountain bear's sensibility fish's breath and bird's spittle

lines.value: francisco jose de goya y lucientes 30 march 1746 - 30 april 1828 was a spanish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he painted many portraits of the spanish royal family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his most famous paintings are charles iv of spain and his family and the third of may 1808
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he regularly painted the famous duchess of alba
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya was born in fuendetodos in the region of aragon spain in 1746
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his parents were jose benito de goya y franque and gracia de lucientes y salvador
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he spent his childhood in fuendetodos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father's work was gilding putting gold onto picture frames
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in about 1749 the family moved to a house in the city of zaragoza
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya went to school at escuelas pias
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became best friends with martin zapater
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: through their lives they wrote many letters to each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of these letters historians know a lot about goya's life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he was 14 goya became an apprentice to the painter jose luzan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya later moved to madrid where he studied with anton raphael mengs a painter who was popular with spanish royalty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya and mengs did not like each other and goya got bad marks in his examinations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya tried to join the spanish royal academy of fine art in 1763 and 1766 but failed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he then traveled to rome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1771 he won second prize in a painting competition in the city of parma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later that year he returned to zaragoza
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he got work painting frescos in several buildings including the dome of the basilica of the pillar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he studied with the painter francisco bayeu y subias
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his painting began to show the style which later made his famous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya married bayeu's sister josefa in 1774
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: francisco bayeu was a member of the spanish royal academy of fine art
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this helped goya to get work with the royal tapestry workshop
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he worked there for 5 years and designed 42 patterns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of his designs were made into tapestries and used to decorate the bare stone walls of the royal palaces such as el escorial
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the spanish royal family saw his works and later gave him work as a portrait painter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also painted an altarpiece holy picture for the church of san francisco el grande
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this picture goya was at last made a member of the spanish royal academy of fine art
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1783 the count of floridablanca commissioned goya gave goya the paid work to paint his portrait
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then king charles iii of spain and other important people wanted goya to paint their portraits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya became friends with crown prince don luis and lived in his house
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from 1788 in the reign of charles iv goya became even more popular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 1790s goya became ill
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is not known exactly what his illness was
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is believed that he suffered mental breakdown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he may have had viral encephalitis or several strokes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he may have suffered from dementia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also thought that he may have been poisoned by lead paint
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his sight hearing balance and mental health were all affected
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from the 1790s onwards he began to paint pictures showing sad violent subjects
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his unhappiness was also affected by the french invasion of spain in 1808
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of his most famous paintings the third of may 1808 is about the execution of spanish men trying to defend their country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the defeat of the french goya did not get on well with king ferdinand vii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya moved to a house far away from the court
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he lived there with his housekeeper and her daughter and taught painting to the girl rosario weiss
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the walls of the house are painted with strange dark pictures but it is not sure whether goya did them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for two years goya lived in france but returned to spain where he was warmly welcomed home in 1826 he died in 1828 at the age of 82
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya's early cartoons for the royal tapestries are scenes of festivals in bright colours
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya painted portraits of many famous people including the duke of wellington
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his paintings of the royal family of charles iv of spain and ferdinand vii show them looking like very ordinary people not like proud nobility
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: queen maria luisa was delighted with the large portrait that he did of her family in 1800 even though a french writer theophile gautier said that goya made them look like the corner baker and his wife after they had won the lottery
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two of goya's most famous paintings were owned by a member of the royal court manuel de godoy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these two paintings are called the nude maja la maja desnuda and the clothed maja la maja vestida
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nude painting was thought of as very shocking
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1813 the inquisition said that both paintings were pornography and took them away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were returned to goya in 1836
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nobody knows who the woman was that posed for goya
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one idea is that she was the duchess of alba
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she may have been godoy's mistress
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: perhaps goya painted the figure from his imagination
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is only one earlier nude painting by a spanish artist velazquez's venus and cupid see national gallery london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when this painting was done other nude figures painted in italy germany and other countries always showed the woman as a goddess from mythology or had some other allegorical meaning was a symbol of some sort
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this painting is unusual because the nude figure is not meant to be a goddess and does not seem to have any symbolic meaning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the very first life sized female nude in western painting that is just about the beauty of the female body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1793 and 1794 goya was recovering from his illness
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this time he painted eleven small pictures painted on tin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these pictures are known as fantasy and invention today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they show a change in his art
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from that time on he painted dark frightening pictures about war violence and madness
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one painting is called courtyard with lunatics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a scene in a mental asylum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is about loneliness and fear
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it shows how mentally ill people have trouble dealing with other people and normal life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya was the first artist to paint people with mental illness in a realistic way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya wanted to show that it was wrong to punish mentally ill people and lock them up with criminals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was a movement at this time to improve the life of people in asylums and prisons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya made two series of prints
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first was called caprichos and the second was called the disasters of war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caprichos series shows nightmarish scenes of the problems with spanish society
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the disaster of war shows scenes of terrible violence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these were not published until more than 30 years after his death
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the disaster of war were made because of the war between france and spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of goya's most famous paintings is a large picture called the third of may 1808.(see above it is about the executions of spanish men that took place in 1808
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this painting shows the courage of the unarmed spanish hero
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it shows the french soldiers in the firing squad acting as if they have no minds or feelings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this painting was a great inspiration to other painters such as the french painter manet who painted a scene of the execution of the governor of mexico
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya's most frightening picture shows a giant man eating people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is now called saturn devouring his sons after saturn the father of the gods in greek mythology but no one knows what it really means
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is more likely a picture of the way that war destroys people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the house that goya owned there are paintings on the walls known as the black paintings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they show scenes with the devil and witches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is not sure whether goya really painted them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: goya's brightly coloured tapestry cartoons influenced the french impressionist painters such as monet and renoir
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his portraits were an influence on manet and degas as well as renoir
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the black paintings influenced expressionist painters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: flowering plants also called angiosperms or magnoliophyta are the dominant land plants today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: together with the gymnosperms they make up the seed plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are different from the gymnosperms because angiosperms bear flowers and have enclosed ovules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gymnosperms bear naked seeds on cones or open structures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: angiosperms have a number of derived characters which evolved as they split off from the gymnosperms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * flowers flowers the reproductive organs of flowering plants are the most remarkable feature distinguishing them from other seed plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: flowers with their colour and their nectar act to attract pollinators which are mostly insects and birds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: whereas gymnosperms are almost entirely wind pollinated early flowers were probably all insect pollinated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some present day flowering plants are wind pollinated but that is a secondary feature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: p182 * fruits the fertilized angiosperm ovule develops into a seed and the ovary develops into the fruit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fruit is often a way to use animals to spread the seeds far and wide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fruit is made out of the carpel and some tissue round it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the carpel hold inside itself the ovules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * endosperm in general endosperms form after fertilization and before the first division of the zygote
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: endosperm is a highly nutritive tissue that can provide food for the developing embryo the cotyledons and sometimes the seedling when it first appears
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * sexual parts specialised sexual parts have led to co evolution in fertilization and seed dispersal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the stamens and the male and female gametophytes have been adapted in many ways to suit particular pollinators
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the smaller pollen grain shortens the time between pollination and fertilization which can be up to a year in gymnosperms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the small female gametophyte also allows rapid seed production which led to annual herbaceous life cycles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: adaptations in these novelties allowed angiosperms to invade many habitats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they now dominate everywhere except the boreal forest or taiga which is still composed almost entirely of gymnosperms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a whole genome duplication doubling at 160 million years ago mya may have started the ancestral line that led to all modern flowering plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that event was studied by sequencing the genome of an ancient flowering plant amborella trichopoda
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: amborella found on the pacific island of new caledonia belongs to a sister group of the other flowering plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: studies suggest that it has features that may have been characteristic of the earliest flowering plants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earliest known fossil confidently identified as an angiosperm archaefructus liaoningensis is dated to about 125 mya in the lower cretaceous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pollen probably of angiosperm origin takes the fossil record back to about 130 mya

lines.value: note the polar moment of inertia must not be confused with the moment of inertia which characterizes an object's angular acceleration due to an applied torque
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the polar moment of inertia is a measure of an object's ability to resist torsion as a function of its shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is one aspect of the area moment of inertia or second moment of area linked through the perpendicular axis theorem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: where the planar second moment of area uses a beam's cross sectional shape to describe its resistance to deformation bending when subjected to a force applied in a plane parallel to its neutral axis the polar second moment of area uses a beam's cross sectional shape to describe its resistance to deformation torsion when a moment torque is applied in a plane perpendicular to the beam's neutral axis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while the planar second moment of area is most often denoted by the letter in engineering textbooks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the calculated values for the polar moment of inertia are most often used describe a solid or hollow cylindrical shaft's resistance to torsion as in a vehicle's axle or drive shaft
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when applied to non cylindrical beams or shafts the calculations for the polar moment of inertia becomes erroneous due to warping of the shaft beam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in these instances a torsional constant should be used where a correctional constant is added to the value's calculation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the polar moment of inertia carries the units of length to the fourth power (, can be broken into its in essence as the magnitude of the polar moment of inertia increases i.e large object cross sectional shape more torque will be required to cause a torsional deflection of the object
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it must be noted that this does not have any bearing on the torsional rigidity provided to an object by its constituent materials the polar moment of inertia is simply rigidity provided to an object by its shape alone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: torsional rigidity provided by material characteristics is known as the shear modulus reduces the potential for angular deflections
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a spindle sometimes called a drop spindle is a wooden spike or shaft that has at one end a weight mostly a circular whorl
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes it has a hook at either end of the spike
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is used for spinning wool and other fibres into thread
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spindles or parts of them have been found in very very old archaeological sites they may represent one of the earliest pieces of technology available to humankind

lines.value: the household income in the united states is a measure of current private income commonly used by the united states government and private institutions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to measure the income of a household the pre tax money receipts of all residents over the age of 15 are combined
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of these receipts are in the form of wages and salaries before withholding and other taxes but many other forms of income such as unemployment insurance disability child support etc are included as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the residents of the household do not have to be related to the householder for their earnings to be considered part of the household's income
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while the use of household income remains among the most widely accepted as households tend to share a common economic fate the size of a household which is commonly not considered may off set gains in household income
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2005 the median annual household income according to the us census bureau was determined to be $46326 similar to that of canada which was roughly $41510 usd in the year 2000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the median income per household member including all working and non working members above the age of 14 in the year 2003 was $23535
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the year 2005 there were approximately 113146000 households in the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 17.23% of all households had annual incomes exceeding $100000 while another 12.7% fell below the federal poverty threshold while the bottom 20% earned less than $19178
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while the aggregate income distribution tends to tilt towards the top with the top 6.37% earning roughly one third of all income those with upper middle incomes also controlled a large though declining share of the total earned income
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: households in the top quintile 77% of which had two income earners had incomes exceeding $91705
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: households in the mid quintile with a mean of one income earner per household had incomes between $36000 and 57657
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 2005 economic survey also found that households in the top 40% those with an annual household income exceeding $55331 had a median of two income earners while those in the lower quintiles 2nd and middle quintile had median of only one income earner per household
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: due to high unemployment among those in the lowest quintile the median number of income earners for this particular group was determined to be zero
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: overall the united states followed the trend of other developed nations with a relatively large population of relatively rich households outnumbering the poor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: among those in between the relative extremes of the income strata a large and quite powerful section of households with moderately high middle class incomes and an even larger number of households with moderately low incomes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while the median household income has increased 44% since 1990 it has decreased very slightly when considering inflation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1990 the median household income was determined to be $30056 $44603 in 2003 dollars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while personal income has remained relatively stagnant since over the past few decades household income has risen due to the rising percentage of households with two or more income earners
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between 1999 and 2004 household income stagnated showing a slight increase since 2004
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: source us census bureau 2005

lines.value: households are often divided into quintiles according to their gross income

lines.value: household type is strongly correlated with household income

lines.value: the highest income households are almost ten times as likely to own their homes rather than rent but in the lowest quintile the ratio of owners to renters is nearly one to one

lines.value: while caucasians who were not of hispanic descent made up roughly 75.1% of all persons in 2000 87.93% of all households in the top 5% were headed by a person who identified as being white alone

lines.value: since 1967 the median household income in the united states has risen modestly fluctuating several times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though personal income has risen substantially and 42% of all household now have two income earners the median household income has increased only slightly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the us census bureau this paradoxical set of trends is due to the changing structure of american households
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example while the proportion of wives working year round in married couple households with children has increased from 17% in 1967 to 39% in 1996 the proportion of such households among the general population has decreased
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thus while married couple households with children are the most economically prosperous type of household in the united states their share of the population has been dwindling in the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1969 more than 40% of all households consisted of a married couple with children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by 1996 only a rough quarter of us households consisted of married couples with children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a result of these changing household demographics median household income rose only slighly despite an ever increasing female labor force and a considerable increase in the percentage of college graduates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: overall the median household income rose from $33338 in 1967 to an all time high of $44922 in 1999 and has since decreased slightly to $43318
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: decreases in household income are visible during each recession while increases are visible during economic upturns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these fluctuations were felt across the income strata as the incomes of both the 95th and 20th percentile were affected by fluctuations in the economy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: yet it is important to note that income in the period between 1967 and 1999 grew faster among wealthier households than it did among poorer households
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example the household income for the 80th percentile the lower threshold for the top quintile rose from $55265 in 1967 to $86867 in 2003 a 57.2% increase
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the median household income rose by 30% while the income for the 20th percentile the lower threshold for the second lowest quitile rose by only 28% from $14002 to $17984
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one should note that the majority of households in the top quintile had two income earners versus zero for the lowest quintile and that the widening gap between the top and lowest quintile may largely be the reflection of changing household demographics including the addition of women to the workforce
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another common measurement of personal income is the mean household income
