lines.value: abalone from spanish abulon are a type of gastropod shellfish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: abalone are known by their colorful inside shell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is also called ear shell ormer in guernsey perlemoen in south africa and paua in new zealand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the meat of this shellfish is thought to be delicious in some parts of latin america especially chile south east asia and east asia especially in china japan and korea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: abalones live all over the world they can be seen along the waters of every continent except the atlantic coast of south america the caribbean and the east coast of the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most abalones are found in cold waters along the coasts of new zealand south africa and australia and western north america and japan in the northern hemisphere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the chilean pacific coast the species called loco concholepas concholepas bruguiere 1789 has a hard black shell and is eaten by many people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: abalone have unique features the shell is round with two to three spirals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the last spiral is grown into a large ear like shape which explains the name ear shell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the inside of the shell is shiny from silvery white to green red mother of pearl
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: abalones can start to give birth at a small size
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their fertility is high and increases with size from 10000 to 11 million eggs at a time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: young albalones called larvae feed on plankton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the adults eat plants and feed on algae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they like to eat red algae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their size can be as small as 20 mm to as big as 200 mm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the shell of the abalone is known for being very strong
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is made of very tiny calcium carbonate tiles stacked like bricks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between the layers of tiles is a sticky protein substance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: allergic skin reactions and asthma attacks can happen when breathing the dust made when these tiles are broken down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the colorful inside part of the abalone shell can be used for decorative inlays in guitars for example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sport harvesting of red abalone is allowed with a california fishing license and an abalone stamp card
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: abalone may only be taken using breath hold techniques freediving or shorepicking
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: scuba diving for abalone is strictly not allowed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: abalone harvesting is not allowed south of the mouth of the san francisco bay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a size minimum of seven inches measured across the shell and a limit of three per day and 24 per year that can be taken
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: abalone may only be taken in april may june august september october and november but they may not be taken in july december january february or march
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: transportation of abalone is only legal while the abalone is still attached to the shell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sale of sport caught abalone is illegal including the shell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only red abalone may be taken black white pink and flat abalone are protected by law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an abalone diver normally uses a very thick wetsuit including a hood booties and gloves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he or she would also wear a mask snorkel weight belt abalone iron and abalone gauge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is common to take abalone in water a few inches up to 10 m/28 deep
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: freedivers who can work deeper than 10 m/28 are less common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: abalone are normally found on rocks near food sources kelp
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an abalone iron is used to pry the abalone from the rock before it can fully clamp down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: visibility is normally five to ten feet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: divers commonly dive out of boats kayaks tube floats or directly off the shore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an eight inch abalone is considered a good catch a nine inch would be very good and a ten inch plus 250 mm abalone would be an excellent catch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rock or shore picking is a different method from diving where the rock picker feels below rocks during low tides for abalone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there has been a trade in diving to catch abalones off parts of the united states coast from before 1939
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in world war ii many of these abalone divers were recruited into the united states armed forces and trained as frogmen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a large worldwide black market in the collection and export of abalone meat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in new zealand where abalone is called paua in the maori language this can be a particularly unusual problem where the right to harvest paua can be granted legally under maori customary rights
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when such permits to harvest are abused it is usually difficult to police
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the legal daily limit is 10 paua per diver with a minimum shell length of 125 mm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the limit is strictly enforced by many ministry of fisheries officers with the help of the police
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: paua poaching is a major industry in new zealand with many thousands of abalones being taken illegally mostly undersized
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: convictions have caused removal of diving gear boats and motor vehicles as well as fines and in rare cases imprisonment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ministry of fisheries expects in the year 2004/05 nearly 1000 tons of paua will be poached with 75% of that being undersized
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: highly polished new zealand paua shells are extremely popular as gifts with their striking blue green and purple iridescence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: transporting unprocessed abalone shells out of new zealand is illegal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the largest abalone in south africa the perlemoen haliotis midae can be found along about two thirds of the country's coastline
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: perlemoen diving has been a recreational activity for many years but stocks are currently being threatened by illegal commercial harvesting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unfortunately this has led to a huge decrease in numbers since the second half of the 19th century and ormering is now strictly regulated in order to keep stocks

lines.value: the taking of ormers is now restricted to a number of ormering tides from the january 1 to april 30 which happen on the full or new moon and two days after that

lines.value: gatherers are not allowed to wear wetsuits or even put their heads underwater

lines.value: statistics is the science of data
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it enables the collection analysis understanding and presentation of data
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it helps in the study of many other fields such as medicine economics psychology and marketing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: someone who works in statistics is called a statistician
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: statistics provides ways to get the data needed for a study without waste such as surveys and controlled experiments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: once the data has been collected there are two basic ways that data can be analysed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: statistics have been in use for a long time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first known statistics are census data
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the babylonians did a census around 3500bc the egyptians around 2500 bc and the ancient chinese around 1000 bc
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before we can describe the world with statistics we must collect data
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the data that we collect in statistics are called measurements
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after we collect data we use one or more numbers to describe each observation or measurement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example suppose we want to find out how popular a certain tv show is
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we can pick a group of people called a sample out of the total population of viewers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then we ask each one how often they watch the show or better we measure it by attaching a counter to each of their television sets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for another example if we want to know whether a certain drug can help lower blood pressure we could give the drug to people for some time and measure their blood pressure before and after
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most often we collect statistical data by doing surveys or experiments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to do a survey we pick a small number of people and ask them questions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then we use their answers as the data
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the choice of which individuals to take for a survey or data collection is important as it directly the statistics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the statistics are done it can no longer be determined which individuals are taken
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: suppose we want to measure the water quality of a big lake
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if we take samples next to the waste drain we will get different results than if the samples are taken in a far away hard to reach spot of the lake
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two kinds of problems which are commonly found when taking samples
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we can reduce chance errors by taking a larger sample and we can avoid some bias by choosing randomly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however sometimes large random samples are hard to take
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: and bias can happen if different people are not asked or refuse to answer our questions or if they know they are getting a fake treatment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these problems can be hard to fix
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: see also standard error
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the middle of the data is called an average
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the average tells us about a typical individual in the population
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are three kinds of average that are often used the mean the median and the mode
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the examples below use this sample data name | a b c d e f g h i j score| 23 26 49 49 57 64 66 78 82 92
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the formula for the mean is the problem with the mean is that it does not tell anything about how the values are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: values that are very large or very small change the mean a lot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in statistics these extreme values might be errors of measurement but sometimes the population really does contain these values
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example if in a room there are 10 people who make $10/day and 1 who makes $1000000/day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mean of the data is $90918/day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though it is the average amount the mean in this case is not the amount any single person makes and is probably useless
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the median is the middle item of the data
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to find the median we sort the data from the smallest number to the largest number and then choose the number in the middle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if there is an even number of data there will not be a number right in the middle so we choose the two middle ones and calculate their mean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in our example there are 10 items of data the two middle ones are 57 and 64 so the median is 57+64)/2 = 60.5
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another example like the income example presented for the mean consider a room with 10 people who have incomes of $10 $20 $20 $40 $50 $60 $90 $90 $90 $100 and $1000000 the median is $55 because $55 is the average of the two middle numbers $50 and $60
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the extreme value of $1000000 is ignored the mean is $57
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this case the median is close to the value obtained when the extreme value is thrown out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the median solves the problem of extreme values as described in the definition of mean above
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mode is the most frequent item of data
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example the most common letter in english is the letter e
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we would say that e is the mode of the distribution of the letters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example if in a room there are 10 people with incomes of $10 $20 $20 $40 $50 $60 $90 $90 $90 $100 and $1000000 the mode is $90 because $90 occurs three times and all other values occur fewer than three times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there can be more than one mode
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example if in a room there are 10 people with incomes of $10 $20 $20 $20 $50 $60 $90 $90 $90 $100 and $1000000 the modes are $20 and $90
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is bi modal or has two modes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bi modality is very common and often indicates that the data is the combination of two different groups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for instance the average height of all adults in the us has a bi modal distribution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because males and females have separate average heights of 1.763 m 5 ft 9 + 1â2 in for men and 1.622 m 5 ft 4 in for women
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these peaks are apparent when both groups are combined
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mode is the only form of average that can be used for data that can not be put in order
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another thing we can say about a set of data is how spread out it is
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a common way to describe the spread of a set of data is the standard deviation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the standard deviation of a set of data is small then most of the data is very close to the average
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the standard deviation is large though then a lot of the data is very different from the average
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the data follows the common pattern called the normal distribution then it is very useful to know the standard deviation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the data follows this pattern we would say the data is normally distributed about 68 of every 100 pieces of data will be off the average by less than the standard deviation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not only that but about 95 of every 100 measurements will be off the average by less that two times the standard deviation and about 997 in 1000 will be closer to the average than three standard deviations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: we also can use statistics to find out that some percent percentile number or fraction of people or things in a group do something or fit in a certain category
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example social scientists used statistics to find out that 49% of people in the world are males
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 1978 mcmlxxviii was a common year starting on sunday of the gregorian calendar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: :'this article is about the desert
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the article about the country can be found at western sahara the sahara in north africa is the one of the largest deserts in the world and is the largest hot desert
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is bounded by the atlantic ocean the atlas mountains the mediterranean sea the red sea and the sahel region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it runs through many countries including morocco algeria tunisia libya egypt mauritania mali niger chad and the sudan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most parts are uninhabited but some people manage to survive in places where there is water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sahara desert is about 9000000 square kilometers 3.5 million square miles in size
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has been both larger and smaller at different times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the last ice age it became more fertile then dried up again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the hottest place on the earth but not the driest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the driest is the atacama desert in south america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sahara has about the same size as the whole united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sahara has one of the world's most harsh climates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: typically the sahara landscape experiences little rainfall powerful winds and wide temperature ranges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some areas there can be no rainfall for up to years at a time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the summer daytime air temperatures across the sahara often reach over 100 degrees fahrenheit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the winter freezing temperatures may occur in the northern sahara and milder temperatures across the southern sahara
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: snow may fall occasionally in some of the higher mountain ranges and rarely on the desert floor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the highest mountain is 3415 m and is the emi koussi in chad
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some mountain peaks in the sahara desert have snow even in the summer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main mountain ranges is the atlas mountains in algeria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sahara's lowest point lies in the qattara depression in egypt at about 130 metres below sea level
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sand sheets and dunes are about 25% of the sahara
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other parts are mountains steppes with a lot of stones and oases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: several rivers run through the sahara
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however most of them come and go through the seasons except for the nile river and niger river
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: metallic minerals are very important to most saharan countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: algeria and mauritania have several major deposits of iron ore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are alsouranium mines mostly in niger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a lot of phosphates are in morocco and western sahara
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: petroleum is mainly found in algeria where it is very important to the economy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while mineral exploitation has led to economic growth in sahara this has rarely helped the indigenous population as skilled workers have been brought from other countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: of the sahara's around 4 million people most live in mauritania western sahara algeria libya and egypt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dominant groups of people are sahrawis and tuareg people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the largest city is nouakchott mauritania's capital
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other important cities are tamanrasset in algeria and sebha and ghat in libya
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: only 200000 kmÂ² of the sahara are fertile oases where dates corn and fruits are grown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the few fertile regions today are fed by underground rivers and underground basins
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of sahara's oases rests in depressions areas under sea level allowing water to surface from underground reservoirs artesian wells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soil in sahara is low in organic matter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the soil in depressions is often saline
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other sorts of vegetation include scattered concentrations of grasses shrubs and trees in the highlands as well as in the oases and along river beds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some plants are well adjusted to the climate allowing them to germinate within 3 days of rain and sow their seeds within 2 weeks after that
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: animals living in the sahara include gerbil jerboa cape hare and desert hedgehog barbary sheep oryx gazelle deer wild ass baboon hyena jackal sand fox weasel and mongoose
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bird life counts more than 300 species
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: reptiles including 4 species of snake also live here
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most venomous scorpion in the world lives here
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 4000 years ago the sahara was a thriving savanna grassland with a great variety of wildlife
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this included animals such as elephants and giraffes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: climate change has caused the rainfall to be less and turn the sahara into the barren desert wilderness as we know it today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * flora and fauna of the sahara
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microsoft word or ms word often called word is a graphical word processing program that users can type with
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is made by the computer company microsoft
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its purpose is to allow users to type and save documents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: similar to other word processors it has helpful tools to make documents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the program was first released in 1981
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of the ideas and features in microsoft word came from bravo the first graphical writing program
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microsoft bought the bravo program and changed its name to microsoft word
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it first came out it was not very popular and did not sell as well as other writing programs like wordperfect
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although it was not very popular when it came out it had a feature called wysiwyg what you see is what you get which meant that people can change the visual style of writing e.g bold italics by clicking on buttons when in other programs like wordperfect people had to add special codes to change the style of writing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: wysiwyg is now a common feature of all computer writing programs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are versions for microsoft word for other operating systems as well as microsoft windows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: new versions support fewer operating systems although they always support windows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: note word for windows is the name of the microsoft word made for microsoft windows '''
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the program is very popular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: without configuration the program saved the document in a proprietary file format so other programs could not open it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the user sent his document to a friend the friend needed a copy of microsoft word to read the document
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then that friend would probably also save documents in the same secret format of word
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this gave microsoft word a dominant position
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jessica alba born april 28 1981 is an american television and film actress and model
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she made her first movie camp nowhere at age 13 and in the television drama series dark angel 2000-02
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alba later acted in several movies such as honey 2003 sin city 2005 and good luck chuck 2007
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she has been listed in the hot 100 section of maxim magazine every year from 2003 to 2007 and she was voted " woman in the world by fhm in 2007
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in march 2007 a picture of her was used on the cover of playboy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: playboy did not ask her if they could use the picture or tell her they were going to use it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this caused a lawsuit that was later dropped
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alba has won several awards for her acting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these awards include the choice actress award at the teen choice award and a saturn award
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both of these awards were for her acting in the series dark angel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alba was born in pomona california
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: her mother catherine is of danish irish scottish welsh english german and french canadian ancestry and her father mark is mexican american indigenous mexican sephardic jewish spanish and mayan ancestry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she has a younger brother named joshua
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alba's father was in the air force and his career caused them to live in many different places
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they lived in biloxi mississippi and del rio texas before returning to california at age 9
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when she was young alba was ill many times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she had a collapsed lung twice had pneumonia four or five times each year and had problems with her appendix and tonsils
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was in hospitals for much of her childhood
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this meant alba did not spend much time with other children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alba has also said that she had obsessive compulsive disorder when she was a child
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the disorder affected her much less when her family moved to california
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she graduated from high school when she was 16 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after high school she went to the atlantic theater company
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alba wanted to act since she was five
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she took her first acting class at age twelve
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an acting agent signed her nine months later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: her first movie work was a small role in the 1994 movie camp nowhere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at first she was only hired for two weeks but ended up working for two months because another actress dropped out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alba starred in two national television commercials when she was a child
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of these was for nintendo and the other was for jc penney
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she played jessica in three episodes of the nickelodeon comedy series the secret world of alex mack
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alba was then maya in the television series flipper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: her mother was a lifeguard and had taught jessica to swim before she could walk
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is a certified scuba diver
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1998 she acted in brooklyn south in two episodes of beverly hills 90210 and in an episode of the love boat the next wave
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after alba graduated from high school she studied acting with william h macy and his wife felicity huffman at the atlantic theater company
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she became more famous in hollywood in 1999 after acting in the drew barrymore romantic comedy never been kissed and as the main female character in the 1999 comedy horror movie idle hands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she was chosen from a group of 1200 actresses for the role of the genetically engineered soldier on the fox sci fi television series dark angel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the series ran for two seasons from 2000 until 2002
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alba was for a golden globe for her work on that series
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when she trained to be in dark angel alba had to exercise very much and she starved herself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she said a lot of girls have eating disorders and i did too
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: i got obsessed with it she also had obsessive compulsive disorder and panic attacks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she said she has been cooking for herself since the age of twelve so she would not become as fat as her family members
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of alba's most famous movie roles are a dancer in sin city and as marvel comics character sue storm the invisible woman in the fantastic four
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she also acted in into the blue in 2005 and good luck chuck a few years later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2008 alba played her first horror movie role in the eye a remake of the hong kong original
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in february she hosted an academy of motion picture arts and sciences's ceremony
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later in the year she starred in the love guru
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2010 alba appeared in five movies including little fockers and the killer inside me

lines.value: geographically morocco is characterized by a rugged mountainous interior large tracts of desert and a lengthy coastline along the atlantic ocean and mediterranean sea

lines.value: a historically prominent regional power morocco has a history of independence not shared by its neighbours

lines.value: since the foundation of the first moroccan state by idris i in 789 the country has been ruled by a series of independent dynasties reaching its zenith under the almoravid and almohad dynasty spanning parts of iberia and northwestern africa

lines.value: marinid and saadi dynasties continued the struggle against foreign domination and morocco remained the only north african country to avoid ottoman occupation

lines.value: the king of morocco holds vast executive and legislative powers especially over the military foreign policy and religious affairs

lines.value: executive power is exercised by the government while legislative power is vested in both the government and the two chambers of parliament the assembly of representatives and the assembly of councillors

lines.value: the king can issue decrees called dahirs which have the force of law

lines.value: he can also dissolve the parliament after consulting the prime minister and the president of the constitutional court

lines.value: koppen climate types in morocco * overview the country's mediterranean climate is similar to that of southern california with lush forests in the northern and central mountain ranges of the country giving way to dryer conditions and inland deserts further southeast

lines.value: the moroccan coastal plains experience remarkably moderate temperatures even in summer owing to the effect of the cold canary current off its atlantic coast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the rif middle and high atlas mountains there exist several different types of climates mediterranean along the coastal lowlands giving way to a humid temperate climate at higher elevations with sufficient moisture to allow for the growth of different species of oaks moss carpets junipers and atlantic fir which is a royal conifer tree endemic to morocco

lines.value: in the valleys fertile soils and high precipitation allow for the growth of thick and lush forests

lines.value: extreme heat and low moisture levels are especially pronounced in the lowland regions east of the atlas range due to the rain shadow effect of the mountain system

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this always contains http:// at the start

lines.value: it normally connects to port 80 on a computer

lines.value: a more secure version of http is called https hypertext transfer protocol secure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this contains https:// at the beginning of the url
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it encrypts all the information that is sent and received

lines.value: this can stop malicious users such as hackers from stealing the information and is often used on payment websites

lines.value: master race is an idea that one group of people is better than all other people

lines.value: it was also used at different times in the 20th century for example by the nazi party and during apartheid in south africa

lines.value: this idea mostly began in the 19th century

lines.value: it is not a theory liked by any scientists today

lines.value: it claims there is a hierarchy of races or that some races are better than others
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was also claimed that at the bottom of the hierarchy were black skinned people from africa and aborigines from australia while pale skinned nordic people were at the top of the hierarchy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: arthur de gobineau 1816-1882 believed that cultures become bad when races mix

lines.value: in his book moral and intellectual diversity of races (, 1853 55 de gobineau states that the mix of races has a bad influence on culture

lines.value: in his view the development of culture is linked to that of the race

lines.value: when empires are created this leads to a mixing of races

lines.value: during this time charles darwin started to develop his ideas about evolution

lines.value: houston steward chamberlain believed the germanic race was there to save the world

lines.value: they would pick an ethnic group and say that this was better than the other groups

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hamitic theory said that the hamitic people were superior and should rule over the other negroid people in sub saharan africa

lines.value: john hanning speke 1827-64 and charles gabriel seligman 1873-1940 were among the most prominent people with this idea

lines.value: they said that languages that had a grammatical genus were hamitic those that did not were negroid

lines.value: using these criteria to find suitable candidates for indirect rule also led to problems according to the theory the massai were hamitic and should rule in german east africa

lines.value: unfortunately they were unable to make such a system for political and econmic reasons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the explanation was that out of bad luck the massai were a hamitic people kept at a lower level of social development

lines.value: in their place the swahili were picked as the next higher people

lines.value: in german south west africa there was a similar problem the theory identified the khoikhoi as hamitic but they were too few to rule the country

lines.value: for this reason the ovambo were picked for indirect rule

lines.value: the opera opens with a young sailor singing about a wild irish maid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: isolde thinks he is singing about her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is furious and wishes the sea would rise up and sink the ship killing all on board
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is particularly furious with tristan the knight who is taking her to the king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she asks her maid to get tristan but he will not come because his is steering the ship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his henchman kurwenal speaks crossly to brangaene reminding her that isolde's previous fiance morold had been killed by tristan and his head sent back to ireland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: brangaene returns to isolde to tell her about what was said
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: isolde sadly tells her how after morold had died a man called tantris had been brought to her because he was seriously injured and that she had made him better using her powers of healing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however she then found out that his real name was tristan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was ireland's worst enemy and he was the man who had killed morold
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: isolde had tried to kill him with a sword but when tristan had looked into her eyes her heart had become full of love and she had dropped the sword
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tristan had been allowed to go back to cornwall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it seemed now he had told his uncle king marke all about the beautiful isolde and had come to get her so that his uncle could marry her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: brangaene tries to make isolde see that tristan is doing an honourable thing to make her queen of ireland but isolde will not listen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is furious and wants him to drink a potion which had been intended by her mother for king marke and isolde as a love potion but for tristan it would be death
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kurwenal now appears and says that tristan has agreed after all to see isolde
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he arrives isolde tells him that she now knows that he was tantris and that he owes her his life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tristan agrees to drink the potion now prepared by brangaene even though he knows it may kill him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as he drinks isolde snatches the rest of the potion from him and drinks it herself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they both believe they are about to die and they declare their love for one other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kurwenal comes and says that king marke is arriving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: isolde asks brangaene which potion she prepared and is told that it was not the death poison but a love potion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: outside the sailors welcome the arrival of king marke
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a group are hunting at
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: king marke's castle is empty except for isolde and brangaene who stand by a lighted torch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: isolde keeps thinking that the hunting horns are far enough away for her to put out the flames giving the sign for tristan to join her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: brangaene warns isolde that one of king marke's knights melot has seen tristan and isolde looking at one another lovingly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: isolde however thinks that melot is tristan's best friend and desperate to see tristan she puts out the flames
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: brangaene goes to the castle walls to keep a look out as tristan arrives
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tristan and isolde can now tell one another they are madly in love
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they do not notice the night is ending and melot leads marke to find the two lovers in one another's arms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: marke is desperately sad because tristan has been betrayed and also because he himself had come to love isolde
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tristan now asks isolde if she will follow him again into the night and she agrees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: melot and tristan fight but then tristan throws his sword to the side and is seriously wounded by melot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kurwenal has brought tristan home to his castle at kareol in brittany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a shepherd plays a sad tune on his pipes and asks if tristan is awake
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kurwenal says that only isolde's arrival can save tristan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the shepherd says he will keep watch and pipe a happy tune to mark the arrival of any ship
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tristan now wakes up and is sad that it is daylight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his sadness turns to joy when kurwenal tells him that isolde is coming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he asks if her ship is in sight but only the shepherd's sorrowful tune is heard
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tristan sinks back again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he remembers that the shepherd's tune is the one he had heard when his father and then his mother died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he collapses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the shepherd now pipes the arrival of isolde's ship and as kurwenal rushes to meet her tristan in his excitement tears the bandages from his wounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as isolde arrives at his side tristan dies while speaking her name
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: isolde collapses beside him as the appearance of another ship is announced
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kurwenal sees melot marke and brangaene arrive and furiously attacks melot because he had killed tristan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the fight both melot and kurwenal are killed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: marke and brangaene finally reach tristan and isolde
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: marke is terribly sad
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he explains that he has heard about the love potion from brangaene and he had come because he had decided that tristan and isolde should be united
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: isolde seems to wake but in a last aria describing her vision of tristan risen again the liebestod dies of grief
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the very first chord in the piece is very famous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has become known as the tristan chord
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although it had been used before the way wagner used it here was quite new
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it makes the harmony very hazy and the listener does not know for many bars what key the music is in
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it creates a lot of tension
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many other moments like this in the opera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tension goes right through the opera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the story tells of a tension that can only come to rest through death
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: flurbereinigung pronounce flooer be rye nee gung is a word used in germany to refer to the rearranging of fields in agriculture
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the second half of the 20th century flurbereinigung led to major changes in the landscape in the german countryside
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many german farmers used to have several small fields which were not together but were in different places some of them maybe two or three miles away from where they lived
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was particularly a problem in the area to the left of the rhine which had been ruled by napoleon because in the 19th century when a farmer and his wife had died their land was shared between all their children so it got divided into smaller pieces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in other parts of germany only the eldest son inherited the land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the 1960s people understood that it would be much easier for a farmer to have all his fields together so that he did not have to keep making journeys between lots of small fields
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: larger fields are easier to manage and more economical
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the german government encouraged farmers to swap some of their fields among themselves so that each farmer had his land all in one place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the last few years the government have realized that the way the changes have been made are not always good
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nature often suffers when hedgerows are taken away to make fields bigger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: flurbereinigung today tries to keep some of the hedgerows and small groups of trees which sometimes stand in the middle of fields
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are good places for birds to nest and other animals like to live there too
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: winegrowers do not always find it a good thing to have all their land together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because the soil in one field may be slightly different from the soil in a field just farther up the road and this gives the wine a slightly different taste
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also if all their land is on one hillside and a storm hits that hillside and ruins the crops then they have lost everything
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if they have several pieces of land in different places they are less likely to lose all their crops because of one disaster
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: popular opinion in the state against this practice brought the end to this use

lines.value: the island is planned to be given back to the hawaiian people

lines.value: in 1993 the us congress passed a law that recognized the cultural importance of the island required the navy to return the island to the state and directed the navy to do an unexploded ordnance uxo cleanup and environmental restoration"

lines.value: the turnover officially occurred on november 11 2003 but the cleanup has not yet been completed

lines.value: the us navy was given $400 million and 10 years to complete the large cleanup task but this work has gone much slower than planned

lines.value: it is made up of the whole island and waters out to from shore

lines.value: by state law kahoolawe and its waters can only be used for native hawaiian cultural spiritual and subsistence purposes fishing environmental restoration historic preservation and education

lines.value: commercial uses are not allowed

lines.value: the legislature also created the kahoolawe island reserve commission kirc to manage the reserve while it is held in trust for a future native hawaiian sovereignty entity"

lines.value: after the cleanup is finished the restoration of kahoolawe will need ways to control erosion restore the plant life recharge the water table and slowly replace alien plants with native ones

lines.value: pi or n is a mathematical constant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the ratio of the distance around a circle to the circle's diameter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this produces a number and that number is always the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the number is rather strange
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the number starts 3.1415926535897 and continues without end
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: numbers like this are called irrational numbers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the diameter is the longest straight line which can be fitted inside a circle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it passes through the center of the circle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the distance around a circle is known as the circumference
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though the diameter and circumference are different for different circles the number pi remains constant its value never changes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is because the relationship between the circumference and diameter is always the same
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pi unrolled 720.gif without repeating in a pattern and that it is impossible to write the exact value of pi as a number
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pi can only be approximated or measured to a value that is close enough for practical purposes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a value close to pi is 3.141592653589793238462643 a common fraction approximation of pi is is more accurate giving about 3.14159292 and can be used when a value closer to pi is needed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: computers can be used to get better approximations of pi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the value of pi was known to ancient indian mathematicians like bhaskaracharya and aryabhatt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mathematicians have known about pi for thousands of years because they have been working with circles for the same amount of time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: civilizations as old as the babylonians have been able to approximate pi to many digits such as the fraction 25/8 and 256/81

lines.value: most historians believe that ancient egyptians had no concept of n and that the correspondence is a coincidence

lines.value: the first written reference to pi dates to 1900 bc around 1650 bc the egyptian ahmes gave a value in the rhind papyrus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the babylonians were able to find that the value of pi was slightly greater than 3 by simply making a big circle and then sticking a piece of rope onto the circumference and the diameter taking note of their distances and then dividing the circumference by the diameter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: knowledge of the number pi passed back into europe and into the hands of the hebrews who made the number important in a section of the bible called the old testament
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after this the most common way of trying to find pi was to a shape of many sides inside any circle and use the area of the shape to find pi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the greek philosopher archimedes for example used a polygon shape that had 96 sides in order to find the value of pi but the chinese in 500 ad were able to use a polygon with 16384 sides to find the value of pi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the greeks like anaxagoras of clazomenae were also busy with finding out other properties of the circle such as how to make squares of circles and squaring the number pi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since then many people have been trying to find out more and more exact values of pi

lines.value: in the 16th century better and better ways of finding pi became available such as the complicated formula that the french lawyer francois viete developed

lines.value: another mathematician named lindeman was also able to show in 1882 that pi was part of the group of numbers known as transcendentals which are numbers that cannot be the solution to a polynomial equation

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they released their first album too fast for love in 1981 and later got signed to a major label

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the band created some negative attention because of their use of illegal drugs large amounts of sex with women and appearances including make up and several tattoos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nikki sixx took an overdose of heroin in 1987 and was legally dead for five minutes before getting an adrenaline shot making him conscious again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the band stopped their drugs and drinking shortly after and released their most popular album dr feelgood in 1989
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the band started arguing and vince neil was out of the band in 1992 as a result
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so the band found a new singer called john corabi who also played guitar and wrote lyrics with the band
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they released their self titled album in 1994
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it created a mixed response from fans who preferred vince neil as the band's singer and did not like the music itself which sounded less like glam rock and more like hard rock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: john corabi left in 1996 and vince neil came back

lines.value: the band released generation swine in 1997 but created a mixed response due to the musical experiments on the album

lines.value: tommy lee was unhappy with vince neil back in the band and further arguments between band members caused lee to leave the band being replaced by randy castillo

lines.value: the band released their least successful album new tattoo in 2000

lines.value: it sounded more like the band's 80s albums rather than the more experimental albums they released in the 90s

lines.value: the mobius strip or mobius band is a surface with only one side and only one edge

lines.value: the twisting is possible in two directions so there are two different mirror-image mobius strips
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mobius strip is known for its unusual properties
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a bug crawling along the center line of the loop would go around twice before coming back to its starting point
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cutting along the center line of the loop creates one longer band not two
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cutting one third of the way in from the edge and parallel to it produces another amusing result
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mobius strip was discovered independently by the german mathematicians august ferdinand mobius and johann benedict listing in 1858
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one way to represent the mobius strip as a subset of where 0 â¤ a < 2n and â1 â¤ r â¤ 1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this creates a mobius strip of width 1 whose center circle has radius 1 lies in the xy plane and is centered at 0 0 0

lines.value: the parameter u runs around the strip while v moves from one edge to the other.in [[cylindrical coordinates|cylindrical polar coordinates r o z an unbounded version of the mobius strip can be represented by the equation topologically the mobius strip can be defined as the square [01] x [01] with its top and bottom sides identified by the relation x 0 ~ 1 â x 1 for 0 â¤ x â¤ 1 as in the diagram on the right.the mobius strip is a two dimensional compact manifold i.e a surface with boundary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a standard example of a surface which is not orientable

lines.value: the mobius strip is also a standard example used to illustrate the mathematical concept of a fiber bundle

lines.value: specifically it is a nontrivial bundle over the circle s 1 with a fiber the unit interval i = [01]

lines.value: looking only at the edge of the mobius strip gives a nontrivial two point or z 2 ) bundle over s 1 .a simple construction of the mobius strip which can be used to portray it in computer graphics or modeling packages is as follows :

lines.value: thallium is a chemical element
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has the chemical symbol tl
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has the atomic number 81
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its standard atomic weight is 204.4
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is found in group 15 of the periodic table
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thallium is a gray metal that is very toxic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thallium is a soft malleable grayish post transition metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be cut with a knife at room temperature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it melts at a low temperature 304Â°c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is typical of a post transition metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thallium has 25 isotopes and two stable nonradioactive ones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is extremely toxic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thallium is a moderately reactive metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it corrodes easily in air with a blue gray color that is similar to lead
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if it is kept in air for a long time a large amount of thallium(i oxide will build up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it corrodes in the presence of water to make the hydroxide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it burns with a greenish flame
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it reacts with most acids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thallium makes chemical compounds in two oxidation states +1 and +3
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the +1 state is more common and less reactive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its chemical compounds are very similar to potassium or silver compounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it makes a hydroxide that in a strong base when dissolved in water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most other transition metal and post trnansition metal hydroxides do not dissolve in water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this reacts with carbon dioxide to make thallium(i carbonate which is also water soluble and very heavy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the only heavy metal carbonate that can dissolve in water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other compounds are similar to silver compounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thallium(i bromide turns yellow when exposed to light similar to silver(i bromide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thallium(i sulfide is black similar to silver(i sulfide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the +3 state compounds are oxidizing agents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the black oxide thallium(iii oxide and the hydroxide thallium(iii hydroxide are the only stable +3 compounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they break down to oxygen and thallium(i oxide when heated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thallium and its compounds are rare because they are toxic and polluting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: +1 compounds are quite unreactive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the more common oxidation state
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are made when thallium dissolves in acids or corrodes in air
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: +3 compounds are oxidizing agents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are quite rare
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oort cloud or opik-oort cloud is a cloud of comets and other objects
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: astronomers believe it is way beyond the orbits of pluto and the kuiper belt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oort cloud is believed to be the source of long period comets in the solar system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oort cloud may lie about 50000 au or nearly a light year from the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means the cloud is nearly a quarter of the way to proxima centauri the nearest star to the sun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kuiper belt and scattered disc the other two reservoirs of trans neptunian objects are less than one thousandth of the oort cloud's distance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the outer limit of the oort cloud defines the boundary of the solar system and the region of the sun's gravitational dominance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dutch astronomer jan hendrik oort was the creator of the oort cloud idea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oort cloud was named after him as were the oort comet and oort constants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oort cloud takes up a lot of space and has trillions of comets about tens of millions of kilometers apart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oort cloud is made up of an inner oort cloud and an outer oort cloud
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the outer cloud is weakly bound to the sun long term comets are thought to come from there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the inner cloud is also called the hills cloud and may be the maker of comets
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the objects in the oort cloud are believed to consist of much ice and since the object 1996 pw was found it is believed that rocky objects might be in the oort cloud
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oort cloud is thought to be the remains of a disk made out of gas which surrounded the sun long ago

lines.value: hasidic judaism or hasidism is a jewish religious movement that was started by rabbi israel ben eliezer the baal shem tov

lines.value: the followers of hasidism are called hasidim

lines.value: hasidism teaches about the importance of serving god with happiness and believes in jewish mysticism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while hasidim study the same books of torah as the rest of judaism they focus on learning the hidden aspects of the text as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hasidic study also includes many of the teachings of kabbalah
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hasidism has strict laws about physical contact between the genders hasidic men will not even shake hands or make any physical contact with unrelated members of the opposite gender and hasidic women will not make any physical contact with unrelated members of the opposite gender and also limit conversation

lines.value: each hasidic group has a leader who is called the rebbe

lines.value: some of the jobs that he does are giving lectures on torah and chassidut and taking part in the different events of his hasidim like weddings and bris milahs

lines.value: they all share similar s but they also have individual customs

lines.value: kurt schumacher born 13 october 1895 in kulm west prussia now chelmno in poland died 20 august 1952 in bonn was a german politician
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was leader of the spd from 1946 to 1952 and speaker of the spd in the bundestag 1949-1952
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: schumacher was born as the son of a salesman
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when world war i started he left school to join the german army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in december 1914 he was badly hurt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his arm had to be removed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after this he went back to school in berlin to study law and politics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while there he became a socialist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1924 he was elected to the legislature in wurttemberg
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became the spd leader for wurttemberg in 1928
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1930 he was elected to the national legislature the reichstag
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the nazis took control of germany schumacher was arrested
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was beaten badly in prison
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was put into concentration camps for the next ten years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1943 schumacher was set free because of his bad health
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was arrested again in 1944 and stayed in the concentration camps until the british set them free in april 1945
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the world war ii schumacher put the spd back together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was first chief of the social democrats in west germany after the wwii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was also their first speaker in the federal parliament bundestag and first leader of opposition in the bundestag
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1952 schumacher died in bonn
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dissociative identity disorder did is a mental disorder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was called multiple personality disorder mpd
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is listed in the mental health diagnosis manual dsm iv
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is one of the most controversial mental disorders because people disagree about what causes it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main symptoms of did are a person showing two or more identities or personality states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the person behaves differently depending which identity is in control
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second important symptom is when a person forgets important personal things which people normally do not forget
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a person is not diagnosed with did if the symptoms are caused by drugs illness or with children pretending to play with imaginary friends
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: doctors must also rule out pretending to have did for attention or sympathy and malingering pretending to have did for some personal gain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most patients with did are also diagnosed with other mental disorders
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dsm iv uses the terms identity personality states and alternate identities when talking about did and other people use the term alters to mean the same thing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these words can be confusing since not everyone uses the same definition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: professionals have not agreed on a specific definition for a personality other terms including dissociation and amnesia may also be defined differently by different professionals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when talking about did saying someone changes personalities or alters means the person speaks and acts differently and usually responds to a different name
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dissociation is a symptom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people experience normal dissociation where they stop paying attention to what is happening around them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people with did have pathological dissociation which is much more serious
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it involves problems with memory and attention that make it hard for people to work shop and have relationships with other people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: everyone can dissociate but some people can do it much more easily and to an extreme that can be unhealthy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some doctors think trauma causes the dissociation that is seen in disorders like did
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the dsm iv the symptoms of did are the presence of two or more distinct identities or personality states which are often called alters as well as forgetting things that people normally don't forget
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also the symptoms cannot be caused by drugs or normal childhood play
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people can report having a lot of alters or just a couple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people diagnosed with did have less than ten though some have said they have several thousand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a person diagnosed with did cannot be diagnosed with another dissociative disorder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because people with did hear voices of different alters it may be confused with schizophrenia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the two problems are very different and doctors can usually tell if a patient has did or schizophrenia by asking the right questions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: did is always diagnosed by what patients tell their doctors and what the doctor thinks this means
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are no tests using blood or machines that can tell if someone has did
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: though people have tried diagnosing and studying did using medical imaging or brain scanning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dsm uses the following criteria to diagnose did
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two main ideas about what causes did but there is still disagreement about which is correct
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the trauma model says that did is caused by parents or family that abuse or neglect their children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of these children deny the abuse is happening or pretend it is happening to someone else and this eventually becomes a different identity or alter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people diagnosed with did say they remember being abused by their parents or other caregivers when they were children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when asked about their childhood patients with did are more likely to say they were abused or neglected than people with any other diagnosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the idea that did develops in childhood is disputed because childhood memories are not very reliable and it is not clear if the abuse actually happened
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: though did has been diagnosed in children there are reasons to believe the diagnosis is because of the influence of parents and doctors rather than abuse
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is not enough good scientific evidence about did in childhood to be sure did is actually caused by abuse or something else
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the iatrogenic or sociocognitive model scm of did says it is created during psychotherapy when the therapist creates false memories and patients become convinced they have multiple personalities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some patients may be more likely to develop did in these circumstances because they are naturally more likely to accept their therapists are right about did
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: scm supporters also think that patients have seen did in movies and books and this shows them how people with did are supposed to behave which makes it easier for them to change their behavior when they are supposed to be a new alter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also say the criteria used by the dsm are unclear which makes it hard to agree whether a patient has did or another diagnosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a middle position says that trauma may change how the brain remembers things which makes it easier to remember things that did not actually happen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has also been suggested that early trauma may make children more likely to use their imaginations to pretend abuse or other painful situations are not happening and if they enter therapy when they are older it is easier for therapists to convince them they have did
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is no treatment approach that has been scientifically proven to work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most therapists who treat patients with did use several different approaches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: therapy usually lasts for several years and does not always work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some therapists try to reduce or eliminate the alters so the patient only has one personality while others do not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isstd recommends first improving a patient's ability to deal with symptoms and live more normal lives then trying to deal with traumatic memories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the final step is bringing all the identities together so the patient can access all of their memories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes patients with did will get better without any help but this is not common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: patients with more diagnoses than just did often take longer to improve
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there have been no large scale studies to learn how common did is
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the isstd says did occurs in between 1 and 3% in the general population and between 1 and 5% in groups of patients in hospitals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: did is more common in women than in men but this may be caused by men with did being sent to prison instead of hospitals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the number of people diagnosed with did increased from about 200 in 1970 to about 20000 in the 1990s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the isstd this is because doctors did not have the training or experience to recognize did
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead they diagnosed people with depression ptsd or borderline personality disorder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people who support the scm say the increase in diagnoses was because a small number of doctors diagnosed a large number of people and because a large number of therapists began using types of psychotherapy that made people think they had did
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before 1900 it was thought did was caused by spirits or ghosts who controlled people's behavior
lines.name: Simple English
