lines.value: windows internet explorer august 16 1995 - april 26 2016 formerly known as ie microsoft internet explorer and msie was a series of graphical web browsers developed by microsoft
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was included as part of the microsoft windows operating system starting in 1995
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was first released as part of the add on package microsoft plus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for windows 95 that year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later versions were available as free downloads or in service packs and included in releases of windows 95 and later versions of windows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ie has been the most popular web browser since 1999 attaining a peak of about 95% usage share during 2002/2003 with ie5 and ie6
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since its peak of popularity its usage share has declined in the face of renewed competition from other web browsers to 55% and is slowly trending downward
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microsoft spent over $100 million per year on ie in the late 1990s with over 1000 people working on it by 1999
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the latest release is internet explorer 11
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer was originally planned to be omitted from windows 7 and windows server 2008 r2 in europe but microsoft later dropped the plans and instead included a browser ballot screen with the products allowing users to select a different web browser if they wish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: windows 10 does not include explorer but rather microsoft edge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: versions of internet explorer for other operating systems have also been produced including an embedded oem version called internet explorer for windows ce ie ce available for wince based platforms and currently based on ie6 internet explorer for pocket pc later rebranded internet explorer mobile which is made for windows mobile and windows ce and remains in development alongside the more advanced desktop versions and the discontinued internet explorer for mac and internet explorer for unix solaris and hp ux
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the internet explorer project was started in the summer of 1994 by thomas reardon using source code from spyglass inc mosaic an early commercial web browser with formal ties to the pioneering ncsa mosaic browser
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in late 1994 microsoft licensed spyglass mosaic for a quarterly fee plus a percentage of microsoft's non windows revenues for the software
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although bearing a name similar to ncsa mosaic the spyglass mosaic had used the ncsa mosaic source code sparingly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 1 made its debut on august 16 1995
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was a reworked version of spyglass mosaic which microsoft had licensed like many other companies initiating browser development from spyglass inc it came with microsoft plus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for windows 95 and the oem release of windows 95
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was installed as part of the internet jumpstart kit in plus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the internet explorer team began with about six people in early development
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 1.5 was released several months later for windows nt and added support for basic table rendering
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however by including it for free on their os they did not have to pay royalties to spyglass inc which resulted in a lawsuit and a multi million usd settlement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 2 was released for windows 95 windows nt 3.5 and nt 4.0 on november 22 1995 following a 2.0 beta in october
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it featured support for ssl cookies vrml rsa and internet newsgroups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: version 2 was also the first release for windows 3.1 and macintosh system 7.0.1 ppc or 68k although the mac version was not released until january 1996 for ppc and april for 68k
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: version 2.1 for the mac came out in august 1996 although by this time windows was getting 3.0
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: version 2 was included in windows 95 osr 1 and microsoft's internet starter kit for windows 95 in early 1996
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it launched with twelve languages including english but this expanded to 24 20 and 9 for win 95 win 3.1 and mac respectively by april 1996
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 2.0i version supported double byte character set
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 3 was released on august 13 1996 and went on to be much more popular than its predecessors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 3 was the first major browser with css support although this support was only partial
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also introduced support for activex controls java applets inline multimedia and the pics system for content metadata
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: version 3 also came bundled with internet mail and news netmeeting and an early version of the windows address book and was itself included with windows 95 osr 2
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: version 3 proved to be the first more popular version of internet explorer which brought with it increased scrutiny
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the months following its release a number of security and privacy vulnerabilities were found by researchers and hackers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this version of internet explorer was the first to have the blue e logo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the internet explorer team consisted of roughly 100 people during the development of three months
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first major ie security hole the princeton word macro virus loophole was discovered on august 22 1996 in ie3
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: backwards compatibility was handled by allowing users who upgraded to ie3 to still use the last ie because the installation converted the previous version to a separate directory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 4 released in september 1997 deepened the level of integration between the web browser and the underlying operating system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: installing version 4 on a windows 95 or windows nt 4 machine and choosing windows desktop update would result in the traditional windows explorer also being replaced by a version more akin to a web browser interface as well as the windows desktop itself being web enabled via active desktop
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the integration with windows however was subject to numerous packaging criticisms see united states v microsoft
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this option was no longer available with the installers for later versions of internet explorer but was not removed from the system if already installed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 4 introduced support for group policy allowing companies to configure and lock down many aspects of the browser's configuration as well as support for offline browsing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet mail and news was replaced with outlook express and microsoft chat and an improved netmeeting were also included
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this version also was included with windows 98
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: new features were added that allow you to save and retrieve posts in comment forms which are still not being used today
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 4.5 offered new features such as easier 128-bit encryption
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also offered a dramatic stability improvement over prior versions particularly the 68k version which was especially prone to freezing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 5 launched on march 18 1999 and subsequently included with windows 98 second edition and bundled with office 2000 was another significant release that supported bi directional text ruby characters xml xslt and the ability to save web pages in mhtml format
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ie5 was bundled with outlook express 5
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also with the release of internet explorer 5.0 microsoft released the first version of xmlhttprequest giving birth to ajax even though the term ajax was not coined until years later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was the last with a 16-bit version
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 5.01 a bug fix version was released in december 1999
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: windows 2000 includes this version
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 5.5 followed in july 2000 improving its print preview capabilities css and html standards support and developer apis this version was bundled with windows me
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however version 5 was the last version for mac and unix
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: version 5.5 was the last to have compatibility mode which allowed internet explorer 4 to be run side by side with the 5.x the ie team consisted of over 1000 people by 1999 with funding on the order of 100 million usd per year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 6 was released on august 27 2001 a few months before windows xp
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this version included dhtml enhancements content restricted inline frames and partial support of css level 1 dom level 1 and smil 2.0
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the msxml engine was also updated to version 3.0
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other new features included a new version of the internet explorer administration kit ieak media bar windows messenger integration fault collection automatic image resizing p3p and a new look and feel that was in line with the luna visual style of windows xp when used in windows xp
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 6.0 sp1 offered several security enhancements and coincided with the windows xp sp1 patch release
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2002 the gopher protocol was disabled and support for it was dropped in internet explorer 7
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 6.0 sv1 came out august 6 2004 for windows xp sp2 and offered various security enhancements and new color buttons on the user interface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ie6 updated the original blue e logo to a lighter blue and more 3d look
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microsoft now considers ie6 to be an obsolete product and recommends that users upgrade to ie8
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many corporate it users have not upgraded despite this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 7 was released on october 18 2006
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it includes bug fixes enhancements to its support for web standards tabbed browsing with tab preview and management a multiple engine search box a web feeds reader internationalized domain name support idn extended validation certificate support and anti phishing filter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with ie7 internet explorer has been decoupled from the windows shell unlike previous versions the internet explorer activex control is not hosted in the windows explorer process but rather runs in a separate internet explorer process
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is included with windows vista and windows server 2008 and is available for windows xp service pack 2 and later and windows server 2003 service pack 1 and later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the original release of internet explorer 7 required the computer to pass a windows genuine advantage validation check prior to installing but on october 5 2007 microsoft removed this requirement
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as some statistics show by mid 2008 internet explorer 7 market share exceeded that of internet explorer 6 in a number of regions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 8 was released on march 19 2009
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it had been in development since august 2007 at the latest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on march 5 2008 the first public beta beta 1 was released to the general public
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on august 27 2008 the second public beta beta 2 was released
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is supported in windows xp sp2 and sp3 windows server 2003 sp2 windows vista windows 7 and windows server 2008 on both 32-bit as well as 64-bit architectures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 8 ie8 rc1 was released on january 26 2009
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 8 final was released on march 19 2009
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: security ease of use and improvements in rss css and ajax support are microsoft's priorities for ie8
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it includes much stricter compliance with web standards including a planned full cascading style sheets 2.1 compliance for the release version
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all these changes allow internet explorer 8 to pass the acid2 test
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however to prevent compatibility issues ie8 also includes the ie7 rendering behavior
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sites that expect ie7 quirks can disable ie8's breaking changes by including a meta element in the head section of the html document
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ie8 also includes numerous improvements to javascript support as well as performance improvements although it still does not pass the acid3 test with version 8.0 scoring 20/100
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it includes support for accelerators which allow supported web applications to be invoked without explicitly navigating to them and webslices which allows portions of page to be subscribed to and monitored from a redesigned favorites bar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other features include inprivate privacy features and smartscreen phishing filter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 9 was released on march 14 2011
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it will have complete or nearly complete support for all css 3 selectors border radius css 3 property faster javascript embedded icc v2 or v4 color profiles and hardware accelerated rendering using direct2d and directwrite
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microsoft has confirmed that web open font format woff will also be supported
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: woff is a strong favorite for standardization by the web fonts working group of w3c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ie9 is supposed to fix many issues with internet explorer including support of the css3 standard border radius property which means that people using ie9 will be able to see rounded corners the same way people using firefox can
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microsoft has continued to downplay the importance of passing the acid3 test but speculation that ie9 would support the svg w3c recommendation was ignited when microsoft announced they had joined the svg working group
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at mix 10 the first ie9 platform preview was released which featured support for css3 and svg a new jscript engine called chakra and a score of 55/100 on the acid3 test up from 20/100 for ie8
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on may 5 2010 the second ie9 platform preview was released which featured a score of 68/100 on the acid3 test and faster performance on the webkit sunspider javascript benchmark than the first ie9 platform preview
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on june 23 2010 the third ie9 platform preview was released which scores 83/100 on the acid3 test and introduced support for elements and woff
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on august 4 2010 the fourth ie9 platform preview was released which features a score of 95/100 on the acid3 test and a faster jscript engine than the third ie9 platform preview
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the final build of ie9 is expected to be released in 2011
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: support for the html5 video and audio tags was also promised
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some industry experts predict that microsoft will release ie9 as a major out of band version that is not tied to any particular version of windows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the internet explorer 9 test drive page the system requirements for ie9 are windows vista sp2 with platform upgrade and ie8 or windows 7
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on august 12 2010 microsoft announced that the ie9 public beta would launch on september 15 2010 at a special event in san francisco linked to the idea of beauty of the web it was also confirmed that the browser would only function with windows vista and windows 7
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on september 15 2010 microsoft launched the ie9 public beta
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 10 does not work with windows vista but only for windows 7 and a future release of the windows operating system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 10 was released together with windows 8 in 2012
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: users of windows 7 can download this version from february 2013
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer has been designed to view a broad range of web pages and to provide certain features within the operating system including microsoft update
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the heyday of the browser wars internet explorer superseded netscape only when it caught up technologically to support the progressive features of the time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ;standards support internet explorer using the trident layout engine internet explorer has been subjected to criticism by w3c over its limited support for svg promoted by w3c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ;non-standard extensions internet explorer has introduced an array of proprietary extensions to many of the standards including html css and the dom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this has resulted in a number of web pages that appear broken in standards compliant web browsers and has introduced the need for a quirks mode to allow for rendering improper elements meant for internet explorer in these other browsers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer has introduced a number of extensions to jscript which have been adopted by other browsers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include the innerhtml property which returns the html string within an element the xmlhttprequest object which allows the sending of http request and receiving of http response and the designmode attribute of the contentdocument object which enables rich text editing of html documents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of these functionalities were not possible until the introduction of the w3c dom methods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its ruby character extension to html is also accepted as a module in w3c xhtml 1.1 though it is not found in all versions of w3c html
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microsoft submitted several other features of ie for consideration by the w3c for standardization
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these include the behavior css property which connects the html elements with jscript behaviors known as html components htc html+time profile which adds timing and media synchronization support to html documents similar to the w3c xhtml+smil and the vml vector graphics file format
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however all were rejected at least in their original forms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: vml was however subsequently combined with pgml proposed by adobe and sun resulting in the w3c-approved svg format currently one of the few vector image formats being used on the web and which ie is now virtually unique in not supporting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other non standard behaviors include support for vertical text but in a syntax different from w3c css3 candidate recommendation support for a variety of image effects and page transitions which are not found in w3c css support for obfuscated script code in particular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: support for embedding eot fonts in web pages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ;favicon the favicon short for favorites icon introduced by internet explorer is now also supported and extended in other browsers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it allows web pages to specify a 16-by-16 pixel image for use in bookmarks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in ie support was and still is provided only for the native windows ico format in other browsers it has now been extended to other types of images such as png and gif
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ;usability and accessibility internet explorer makes use of the accessibility framework provided in windows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer is also a user interface for ftp with operations similar to that of windows explorer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pop up blocking and tabbed browsing were added respectively in internet explorer 6 and internet explorer 7
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tabbed browsing can also be added to older versions by installing msn search toolbar or yahoo toolbar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ;cache internet explorer caches visited content in the temporary internet files folder to allow quicker access or offline access to previously visited pages
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the content is indexed in a database file known as index.dat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: multiple index.dat files exist which index different content visited content web feeds visited urls cookies etc prior to ie7 clearing the cache used to clear the index but the files themselves were not reliably removed posing a potential security and privacy risk
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in ie7 and later when the cache is cleared the cache files are more reliably removed and the index.dat file is overwritten with null bytes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ;group policy internet explorer is fully configurable using group policy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: administrators of windows server domains can apply and enforce a variety of settings that affect the user interface such as disabling menu items and individual configuration options as well as underlying security features such as downloading of files zone configuration per site settings activex control behavior and others
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: policy settings can be configured for each user and for each machine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer also supports integrated windows authentication
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer uses a componentized architecture built on the component object model com technology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it consists of several major components each of which is contained in a separate dynamic link library dll and exposes a set of com programming interfaces hosted by the internet explorer main executable : internet explorer 8 introduces some major architectural changes called loosely coupled ie lcie
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lcie separates the main window process frame process from the processes hosting the different web applications in different tabs tab processes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a frame process can create multiple tab processes each of which can be of a different integrity level each tab process can host multiple web sites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the processes use asynchronous inter process communication to synchronize themselves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: generally there will be a single frame process for all web sites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in windows vista with protected mode turned on however opening privileged content such as local html pages will create a new tab process as it will not be constrained by protected mode
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer exposes a set of component object model com interfaces that allow other components to extend the functionality of the browser
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: extensibility is divided into two types browser extensibility and content extensibility
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the browser extensibility interfaces can be used to plug in components to add context menu entries toolbars menu items or browser helper objects bho
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bhos are used to extend the feature set of the browser whereas the other extensibility options are used to expose the feature in the ui
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: content extensibility interfaces are used by different content type handlers to add support for non native content formats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bhos not only have unrestricted access to the internet explorer dom and event model they also can access the filesystem registry and other os components
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: content extensibility can be either in terms of active documents doc objects e.g svg or mathml or activex controls
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: activex controls are used for content handlers that render content embedded within an html page e.g adobe flash or microsoft silverlight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: doc objects are used when the content type will not be embedded in html e.g microsoft word pdf or xps
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in fact the trident rendering engine is itself exposed as a doc object so html in itself is treated as an active document
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer add on components run with the same privileges as the browser itself unlike client side scripts that have a very limited set of privileges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: add ons can be installed either locally or directly by a web site
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the add ons have a more privileged access to the system malicious add ons can and have been used to compromise the security of the system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 6 service pack 2 onwards provide various safeguards against this including an add on manager for controlling activex controls and browser helper objects and a no add ons mode of operation as well as greater restrictions on sites installing add ons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer itself can be hosted by other applications via a set of com interfaces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can be used to embed the browser functionality inside the application
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also the hosting application can choose to host only the mshtml.dll rendering engine rather than the entire browser
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer uses a zone based security framework that groups sites based on certain conditions including whether it is an internet or intranet based site as well as a user editable whitelist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: security restrictions are applied per zone all the sites in a zone are subject to the restrictions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 6 sp2 onwards uses the attachment execution service of microsoft windows to mark executable files downloaded from the internet as being potentially unsafe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: accessing files marked as such will prompt the user to make an explicit trust decision to execute the file as executables originating from the internet can be potentially unsafe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this helps in preventing accidental installation of malware
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer 7 introduced the phishing filter that restricts access to phishing sites unless the user overrides the decision
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with version 8 it also blocks access to sites known to host malware
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: downloads are also checked to see if they are known to be malware infected
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in windows vista internet explorer by default runs in what is called protected mode where the privileges of the browser itself are severely restricted it cannot make any system wide changes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one can optionally turn this mode off but this is not recommended
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this also effectively restricts the privileges of any add ons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a result even if the browser or any add on is compromised the damage the security breach can cause is limited
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: patches and updates to the browser are released periodically and made available through the windows update service as well as through automatic updates
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although security patches continue to be released for a range of platforms most feature additions and security infrastructure improvements are only made available on operating systems which are in microsoft's mainstream support phase
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on december 16 2008 trend micro recommended users switch to rival browsers until an emergency ie patch was released to fix a potential security risk which could allow outside users to take control of a person's computer and steal their passwords
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microsoft representatives countered this recommendation claiming that 0.02% of internet sites were affected by the flaw
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on december 17 2008 a fix to the security problem above became available with the release of the security update for internet explorer kb960714 which is available from microsoft windows update's webpage
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microsoft has said that this update fixes the security risk found by trend micro the previous day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer has been subjected to many security vulnerabilities and concerns much of the spyware adware and computer viruses across the internet are made possible by exploitable bugs and flaws in the security architecture of internet explorer sometimes requiring nothing more than viewing of a malicious web page in order to install themselves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is known as a drive by install
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are also attempts to trick the user into installing malicious software by misrepresenting the software's true purpose in the description section of an activex security alert
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a number of security flaws affecting ie originated not in the browser itself but activex based add ons used by it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because the add ons have the same privilege as ie the flaws can be as critical as browser flaws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this has led to the activex based architecture being criticized for being fault prone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by 2005 some experts maintained that the dangers of activex have been overstated and there were safeguards in place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2006 new techniques using automated testing found more than a hundred vulnerabilities in standard microsoft activex components
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: security features introduced in then recently released internet explorer 7 mitigated some of these vulnerabilities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: internet explorer in 2008 had a number of published security vulnerabilities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to research done by security research firm secunia microsoft did not respond as quickly as its competitors in fixing security holes and making patches available
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the firm also reported 366 vulnerabilities in activex controls an increase from the prior year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the latest information secunia reports that ie6 has 24 known unpatched vulnerabilities ie7 has 11 and ie8 has 4
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most severe unpatched secunia advisories affecting microsoft internet explorer 6.x 7.x and 8.x with all vendor patches applied are all rated extremely critical
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oldest known unpatched vulnerabilities for ie6 ie7 and ie8 date from november 7 2003 june 6 2006 and february 26 2007 respectively
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to the latest information security research firm securityfocus reports that ie6 has 396 known unpatched vulnerabilities ie7 has 22 and ie8 has 25
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the oldest known unpatched vulnerabilities for ie6 ie7 and ie8 date from november 20 2000 may 17 2007 and april 11 2009 respectively
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the vulnerability affected internet explorer 6 ie7 and ie8 on windows 7 vista windows xp server 2003 and server 2008 r2 as well as ie 6 service pack 1 on windows 2000 service pack 4
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the german government warned users against using internet explorer and recommended switching to an alternative web browser due to the major security hole described above that was exploited in internet explorer

lines.value: a cnn article noted at the release of internet explorer 4 microsoft's internet explorer has made inroads and various estimates put its share of the browser market 30 to 35 percent from about 10 percent a year ago by 2002 internet explorer had almost completely superseded its main rival netscape and dominated the market with up to 95 percent market share

lines.value: while a major upgrade of internet explorer can be uninstalled in a traditional way if the user has saved the original application files for installation the matter of uninstalling the version of the browser that has shipped with an operating system remains a controversial one

lines.value: martin van buren december 5 1782 - july 24 1862 was the eighth president of the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the first president born after the united states declaration of independence making him the first president who was born as a us citizen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren was born in kinderhook new york in 1782
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren studied law by working for francis sylvester and later became a lawyer in 1803
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1821 he was elected as a member of the united states senate representing new york
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: president andrew jackson selected him as the secretary of state in 1827
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1832 he became vice president for jackson and in 1836 he became the 8th president of the united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during most of the time he was president the economy was in very bad shape and he was blamed for it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the first president to have been born a united states citizen since all of his predecessors were born british subjects before the american revolution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren lost the next presidential election in 1840 to william henry harrison
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1848 he ran again to be president as a part of the free soil party but he did not win
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren died on july 24 1862 of heart failure after suffering from an asthma attack on his lindenwald estate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: martin van buren was born on december 5 1782 in kinderhook new york south of albany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren was the third born of five children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father abraham van buren was a farmer and a tavern owner
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his mother was maria hoes van buren the granddaughter of a dutch immigrant
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: martin van buren went to school at the kinderhook academy in the village where he lived
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at kinderhook academy he in english and latin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren left the school when he was 14 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1796 van buren started working in the law office of francis sylvester an attorney that worked in kinderhook
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he kept the office clean copied documents and did other jobs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while he was working there he learned about law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after six years under sylvester he spent a final year of apprenticeship in the new york city office of william p van ness
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren passed the new york state bar exam in 1803 and became a lawyer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after becoming a lawyer van buren moved back to kinderhook to work as an attorney with his half brother james j van alen in 1803
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: five years later van buren became the surrogate legal officer of columbia county
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was no fixed term of office
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is van buren would be there until the opposition party was able to elect someone else in his place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren held the office about five years until he was removed on march 19 1813
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren represented new york in the united states senate from 1821 to 1828
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he left the senate to become the governor of new york in 1829
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on march 5 1829 after he became the governor president andrew jackson made van buren the secretary of state so van buren was only the governor for two months
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from 1833 to 1837 he was the vice president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jackson was still president at this time also was leading member of and gained much voting support by free soil party
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: just a few months after van buren became president there was a financial crisis called the panic of 1837
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren believed in limited government and did not respond in a way that many people wanted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people blamed him for the economy becoming worse and this made him less popular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren married hannah hoes a cousin on february 21 1807
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they had five children together abraham john martin jr smith and winfield scott
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: martin van buren developed pneumonia in the fall of 1861
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after developing pneumonia he could not move out of his bed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in july 1862 van buren had a serious asthma attack and began to weaken
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: van buren died on july 24 1862 at his home in kinderhook new york of heart failure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was 79 years old

lines.value: saint petersburg sankt-peterburg/cahkt-netepbypr is a russian city in northwestern russia near the gulf of finland of the baltic sea

lines.value: over five million people live in st petersburg as of 2015 and it is the second biggest city in russia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it connects with the rest of the world's shipping paths through the neva river and the baltic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saint petersburg and its surroundings are a world heritage site called the historic centre of saint petersburg and related groups of monuments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: saint petersburg was started by the russian tsar peter i as the capital of the russian empire in 1703 to take the place of the earlier capital moscow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was the capital of russia until 1918
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: peter the great established saint petersburg as a warm weather port in order to show russian dominance in the baltic and to increase trading opportunities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: peter sought to modernize russia therefore he tried to make saint petersburg as different as possible from the former capital moscow by modernizing the city

lines.value: saint petersburg has changed its name many times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1918 during the russian revolution the soviet capital was moved to moscow still the capital of russia now
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during world war ii the city was surrounded by the german army and under siege for twenty nine months

lines.value: leningrad again took its old name of st petersburg on september 6 1991 when russia stopped being communist

lines.value: ovaries singular ovary are organs found in female organisms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ovaries are part of the reproductive system needed to reproduce sexually
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most vertebrates have ovaries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually animals have two ovaries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: birds usually have only one working ovary snakes have one ovary in front of the other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ovaries are similar to testicles in men
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ovaries are shaped like eggs and are around 3 cm by 1.5 cm by 1.5 cm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ovary is found in the side walls of the pelvis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each ovary is attached to the fallopian tube
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually each ovary takes turns releasing eggs every month
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ovaries have two purposes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during menstruation an ovum is released from the ovary and enters one of the fallopian tubes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there the ovum can be fertilised
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ovaries have a certain number of eggs in them so when eggs stop being released this is the start of the menopause
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during this time female hormones stop being produced

lines.value: a sponge is a member of the phylum porifera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a simple animal with many cells but no mouth muscles heart or brain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is sessile it cannot move from place to place the way most other animals can
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a sponge is an animal that grows in one spot like most plants do
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nevertheless sponges are quite successful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the basic body plan is a jelly like layer sandwiched between two thin layers of cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: their bodies are full of pores and channels allowing water to circulate through them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of them feed on bacteria and other microorganisms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few of them eat tiny crustaceans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are more than 10000 species of sponge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most sponges live in the ocean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few live in fresh water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all sponges take in water through pores little holes in their bodies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the water goes out through a big tube in the center
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most sponges filter take out little bits of food from the water going through their bodies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: animals that get food this way are called filter feeders
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sponges are simple animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few things make them different from other animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are four classes of sponges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the difference between these kinds is in how their skeleton is made
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sponges are sessile they live in one place where they are fixed to the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few sponges can change their position they can move at speeds of between 1 mm and 4 mm a day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they do this like amoebae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few species can contract their whole bodies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many can close their openings holes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few species live in waters where there is very little food available
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have therefore changed and became predators
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they eat small crustaceans and other small animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of these sponges belong to the family cladorhizidae but a few members of the guitarridae and esperiopsidae are also carnivores
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in most cases little is known about how they actually capture prey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some species are thought to use either sticky threads or hooked spicules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most carnivorous sponges live in deep waters up to and the development of deep ocean exploration techniques is expected to lead to the discovery of several more
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however one species has been found in mediterranean caves at depths of 17-23m alongside the more usual filter feeding sponges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cave dwelling predators capture crustaceans under long by entangling them with fine threads digest them by enveloping them with further threads over the course of a few days and then return to their normal shape there is no evidence that they use venom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most known carnivorous sponges have completely lost the water flow system and choanocytes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the genus chondrocladia uses a highly modified water flow system to inflate balloon like structures that are used for capturing prey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sponges usually reproduce make more of their kind when little pieces break off
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if such a piece has the right types of cells it can grow to become a new sponge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few sponges can also use budding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with budding a small sponge grows on the parent when it is done growing it simply falls off
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the conditions are bad some sponges can also grow lumps of unspecialised cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these will not develop until the conditions improve again
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they can then either make a new sponge or they can use the skeleton of the parent sponge that died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most sponges reproduce sexually
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they can make sperm cells that are released into the water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are either captured by another sponge and are then transported to the egg cells of the parent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is known as viviparous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both cells are joined to form larvae which can swim off to find a good place to settle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the other way known as oviparous is that both sperm cells and egg cells are released into the water
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these then combine outside the sponges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a report in 1997 described how bottlenose dolphins in shark bay used sponges as tools a dolphin will attach a marine sponge to its rostrum snoutlike projection
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is thought the sponge is used to protect the rostrum when the dolphin is looking for food in the sandy sea bottom but scientists have not confirmed this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the behaviour known as sponging has only been seen in this bay and is almost exclusively shown by females
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a study in 2005 concluded that mothers teach the behaviour to their daughters and that all the sponge users are closely related
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this suggests that it is a fairly recent innovation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dolphins also use sponges as an exfoliator rubbing their skin against the sponge attached to the rock to get rid of their old dry skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the calcium carbonate or silica spicules of most sponges make them too rough for most uses but two genera hippospongia and spongia have soft entirely fibrous skeletons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: early europeans used soft sponges for many purposes including padding for helmets portable drinking utensils and municipal water filters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: until synthetic sponges were invented they were also used as cleaning tools for painting and as contraceptives
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 20th century overfishing is a problem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this has caused the animals as well as the industry behind it to be close to extinction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many objects with sponge like textures are now made of substances that do not come from poriferans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: synthetic sponges include personal and household cleaning tools breast implants contraceptive sponges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the luffa sponge also spelled loofah which is commonly sold for use in the kitchen or the bath is not derived from an animal but from the fibrous skeleton of a gourd cucurbitaceae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus (, hephaistos is the greek god of fire metalworking craftsmen sculpture metallurgy and volcanoes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his parents were zeus and hera hephaestus was the blacksmith of the gods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was married to the goddess aphrodite who cheated on him with his brother ares
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his symbols were a smith's hammer an anvil and a pair of tongs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the donkey was his sacred animal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the god vulcan is his roman equivalent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when hephaestus was born he was ugly and weak with a broken foot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hera did not like the way he looked and threw him off her castle which was on top of the clouds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus fell for one day and one night before falling into the sea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sea animals rescued him and took him to an island called lemnos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there hephaestus built his forge underneath a volcano
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he collected precious metals pearls and pieces of coral to fashion extraordinary jewelry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus built little robots of gold to help him get around
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus even worked with the cyclopes one eyed creatures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to impress the gods and goddesses he made a set of golden thrones for them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hera realized her mistake of throwing hephaestus off mount olympus and pleaded zeus to welcome hephaestus back
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus politely refused saying that he was quite happy where he was
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: then he set to work and fashioned a beautiful golden throne and sent it to hera as a thank you gift for the invitation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the instant she sat on it golden ropes flew out and tied her up locking her into the chair
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus was still very angry with hera because she threw him off mount olympus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though everyone tried to free hera from the great trap hephaestus design was so clever that none could detach the ropes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so zeus sent his son ares god of war to bring hephaestus back to let hera loose
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead hephaestus made him run away throwing firebrands at him and ares made a shameful retreat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: zeus used trickery next and sent dionysus the god of wine to get hephaestus drunk
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus was not a regular drinker and hephaestus got drunk very quickly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soon dionysus was making his proud return to mount olympus with drunk hephaestus on the back of a mule
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus finally freed hera and moved back to the forges because he did not like the busy life of the palace

lines.value: although he still refused to forgive hera

lines.value: hephaestus made the best weapons jewelry and armor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of his greatest creations ever were the silver bows and arrows of artemis and apollo as well as apollo's golden chariot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also made the shield of achilles athena's spear and hercules breastplate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition to this he made the scepter of zeus and the battle armor of the olympian armies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he also made all of the gods and goddesses palaces and their unbreakable locks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on top of all this hephaestus was and is still credited with the invention of the three legged stool and the world's first robots
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus helpers included a complete set of life size golden maids who helped around the house
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus married aphrodite
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when aphrodite emerged from the sea created by the sperm of the severed member of uranus zeus feared that the gods would battle over her hand in marriage so zeus arranged that aphrodite would marry hephaestus

lines.value: hephaestus gave aphrodite his best creations and even gave her a magic girdle that made her irresistible to men

lines.value: however aphrodite did not love him as she was married against her will and she didn't like hephaestus looks

lines.value: she spent most of her time with ares

lines.value: hephaestus was well liked by all of the olympians

lines.value: hephaestus preferred to be alone in his workshop
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus was also worshiped by the greeks because he proved that those who labor are also noble
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hephaestus reminds us of the value and dangers of losing our selves in work

lines.value: the blackbird turdus merula or common blackbird is a thrush
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a member of the passerine songbird family turdidae
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a huge range across europe asia and north africa and has been introduced to australia and new zealand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a number of subspecies across its range
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: depending on latitude the common blackbird may be resident partially migratory or fully migratory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the adult male is black with a yellow orange bill beak
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: juveniles and females are brown and less easy to see
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: blackbirds are easy to find in gardens all over europe and in asia south of the arctic circle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on average blackbirds live to be 2.4 years old but some have been found to be 20 years old
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a terrific singer and will breed whenever the weather is right
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the male common blackbird defends its breeding territory chasing away other males or utilising a bow and run threat display
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is a short run the head first being raised and then bowed with the tail dipped simultaneously
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a fight between male blackbirds does occur it is usually short and the intruder is soon chased away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the female blackbird is also aggressive in the spring when it competes with other females for a good nesting territory and although fights are less frequent they tend to be more violent
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the male attracts the female with a courtship display oblique runs and head bowing movements an open beak and a strangled low song
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the female stays still until she raises her head and tail to permit copulation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this species is monogamous and the established pair usually stay together as long as they both survive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pair separation rates of up to 20% have been noted following poor breeding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although socially monogamous there have been studies showing as much as 17% extra pair paternity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as long as winter food is available both the male and female will remain in the territory throughout the year although occupying different areas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: migrants are more gregarious travelling in small flocks and feeding in loose groups in the wintering grounds
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the flight of migrating birds comprises bursts of rapid wing beats interspersed with level or diving movement and differs from both the normal fast agile flight of this species and the more dipping action of larger thrushes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: urdu is the name of one of the languages spoken in south asia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the national language of pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is spoken in pakistan and indian administered kashmir and is the official language of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also an official language in india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is spoken all over india particularly in the states of andhra pradesh delhi and uttar pradesh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the origin of the urdu language is the mughal empire's word for army urdu
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however contrary to popular belief urdu was not created in the army camps of the mughal army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: urdu is spoken the same as present day hindi but hindi uses the traditional devanagari script a decedent of sanskrit whereas urdu uses the persio arabic alphabet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the poet ghulam hamadani mushafi coined the term urdu for this language in 1780
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however this began to alienate the two major cultures in india/pakistan the muslims and hindus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hindus began to speak and write hindi whereas muslims would begin to speak urdu
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this also lead to a need to cleanse urdu of all its sanskrit words and lead hindi speakers to want to be rid of persian words that remained in their language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the letters in urdu are derived from the language persian/farsi which is derived from the arabic language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the additional letters that are found in urdu include Ù¹ ,Ú ,Ú á¹« á¸ á¹
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to make the language more enriched two letters were created for sounds Ù h and Û y
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by adding these alphabets to the existing persian alphabets the urdu language became more suitable for the people of north india and pakistan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: urdu is written right to left like farsi script
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: urdu is also written in the nasta liq style of persian calligraphy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nastaliq style is a cursive script invented by mir Ê¿ali of tabriz a very famous calligrapher during the timurid period 1402-1502
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: urdu in its less formalized register has been called a rekhta Ø±ÛØ®ØªÛ ), meaning rough mixture
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the more formal register of urdu is sometimes called zaban-e-urdu-e-mo'alla Ø²Ø¨Ø§Ù Ø§Ø±Ø¯Ù ÙØ¹ÙÛ ), the language of camp and court the etymology of the word used in the urdu language for the most part how nice or well done your speech is
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example urdu speakers would distniguish between Ù¾Ø§ÙÛ pani and Ø¢Ø¨ ab both meaning water for example or between Ø¢Ø¯ÙÛ admi and ÙØ±Ø¯ mard meaning man the first in each set is used colloquial and has older hindustani while the last in the set is used and poetically
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a word is of persian or arabic origin the level of speech is thought to be more formal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if persian or arabic grammar such as the izafat are used in urdu the level of speech is also thought more formal and correct
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a word is inherited from sanskrit the level of speech is thought more colloquial and personal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: urdu is supposed to be a well formed language many of words are used in it to show respect and politeness
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this on politeness which comes from the vocabulary is known as adab and to sometimes as takalluf in urdu
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these words are mostly used when addressing elders or people with whom one is not met yet

lines.value: two very respected poets who are not only celebrated in the indian subcontinent but are famous in many other communities worldwide are mirza ghalib and sir mohammad iqbal

lines.value: ghalib 1797-1869 is famous for his classic satire and sarcasm as seen in the following verse latin/roma alphabet umer bhar hum yun hee ghalati kartey rahen ghalib dhool ch herey pei thee aur hum aaina saaf karte rahe translation o ghalib himself all my life i kept making the same mistakes over and over i was busy cleaning the mirror while the dirt was on my face

lines.value: iqbal 1877-1938 was a poet and an active politician
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he focused his poetry on bringing out the plight of the suffering muslim community
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in his poetry he very boldly highlighted the missing virtues and values in the morally corrupt society
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: despite much opposition in the beginning he ended up leaving a huge impact
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is also called the poet of the east and the poet of islam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his work is displayed in the following verse latin/roma alphabet aapne bhe khafa mujh sei beganey bhe na khush mein zeher e-halal ku kabhi keh na saka qand translation i could not keep happy either my loved ones nor the strangers as i could never call a piece of poison a piece of candy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: iqbal is considered by many an inspirational poet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he played a large role in the pakistan movement with many claiming that he was the one to spark it

lines.value: actuaries are people who are experts in mathematics probability economics and finance who figure out how much money businesses should charge for making promises to pay for something that may or may not happen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hundreds of years ago when people got sick or died it cost a lot of money to take care of them or bury them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people had the idea of joining their money together to help each other out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was called pooling
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eventually people started to make a business out of collecting enough money to help people who had big problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: figuring out how much money needed to be collected from people to be used if problems happened was not easy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over hundreds of years the math needed for this was developed by many people from all over the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today actuaries use computers to figure out problems that were too difficult before
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: actuaries now work in many places
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most work for insurance companies but others work in all kinds of finance companies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: actuaries still figure out how much money needs to be paid for life insurance as well as other kinds of money promises like pensions car insurance house insurance and similar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: actuaries also work with companies to figure out if making certain business deals are a good idea since actuaries work with figuring out what the probabilities are of different business situations happening
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people who want to be actuaries need to take many tests
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tests are not the same in different parts of the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoon is the lowest of the four main instrument of the woodwind family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like the oboe it has a double reed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reed is attached to a curved metal mouthpiece called a crook or bocal which is joined to the main part of the instrument
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this consists of two parts called bass joint and wing joint or tenor joint
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these two are joined at the bottom by a u shaped piece called the boot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the top of the instrument is the bell joint
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the instrument is quite heavy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some players have a neckstrap around their neck to support the weight but usually they use a seat strap that connects at the bottom of the boot and the strap goes across the floor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoonist a person who plays a bassoon then sits on that strap
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoon is held to the right side of the bassoonist and the top of the boot joint is usually level with the players hip
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoon when played right can sound very beautiful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoon has one of the largest note ranges going from low b flat to a high f on the top line of the treble clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoon can also play in tenor clef but usually plays bass clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some bassoons have a white ivory ring round the top of the bell joint
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are german bassoons called heckel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: french bassoons called buffet do not have this ring and also sound quite different to german bassoons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bassoons have keys to help the player to cover all the holes but these keys do not use the boehm fingering system like the other woodwind instruments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: german bassoons use a system called the heckel system and french bassoons use the buffet system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to play the bassoon it is very important to have lots of breathing support
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like with the oboe fast passages can be played using double tonguing single tonguing is like saying tu-tu-tu-tu-tu double tonguing is like saying te-ke-te-ke-te-ke
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in most music the bassoon will spend a lot of time playing a bass line perhaps the same notes as the cello or tuba
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can sometimes sound quite amusing when playing an um-cha-um-cha accompaniment like in the dance of the cygnets from tchaikovsky's swan lake
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can sound very tuneful and sad as in the second movement of rimsky korsakov's sheherazade
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: listen to the opening of stravinsky's rite of spring where it plays some quite high notes to fool people that it is the cor anglais or the english horn
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even a famous composer saint saens did not know what the instrument was
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: prokofiev uses the bassoon for grandfather's tune in peter and the wolf
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also to play the bassoon a player needs big hands because the bassoon's keys and holes are quite wide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the holes are drilled in at an angle so that the upper register is not overblown and produces an unpleasant sound
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: whisper keys were also invented to prevent overblowing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoon is known for its reedy sound
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its upper register is shrill and sometimes scary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: middle register could be used for lullabies because of its majestic and soothing tone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its lower register is deep dark and could be used for scary movies and such
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoon developed from a renaissance instrument called the curtal or dulcian
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these were double reed instruments which often played with shawms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the baroque period the bassoon became popular as an instrument to play the bass line perhaps playing the same as the cello
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a man named hotteterre made many parts of the modern bassoon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the late baroque period composers like antonio vivaldi wrote concertos for bassoon and orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some more famous bassoon concertos include one by mozart and in more recent times by peter maxwell davies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bassoon was a very important instrument in the orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mozart and beethoven gave the bassoon important parts in the music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some pieces with a large orchestra a contrabassoon is used
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this plays an octave lower than a bassoon taking it right down to bottom b flat or c on the piano
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some contrabassoons are made to play a note lower i.e the very lowest note of the piano a
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one might expect to see the contrabassoon sticking up high above all the other instruments in the orchestra but in fact the tube keeps doing u turns making four parallel rows of tubing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are usually made with the bell pointing downwards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the weight is supported by a peg to the floor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the contrabassoon used to be shaped like a bassoon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the contrabassoon adds richness to the sound of a full orchestra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: listen carefully for the contrabassoon in the hymn like introduction to the last movement of symphony no 1 by brahms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be clearly heard growling away in the opening of the piano concerto for the left hand by ravel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: al jazeera in arabic Ø§ÙØ¬Ø²ÙØ±Ø© al jazi'yra is an arabic language television channel from doha qatar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: al jazeera means the island in arabic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is named that way because it claims to be the only independent news network in the middle east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at first it was a satellite tv channel which broadcast in arabic only
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now there is also a channel in english a sports channel a conference channel a documentary channel and a children's channel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: next to its original channel al jazeera also has many other channels about specific things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * al jazeera <div width="60%"> * al jazeera sports <div width="60%"> <div width="60%"> <div width="60%"> <div width="60%"> <div width="60%"> <div width="60%"> * al jazeera mobasher or al jazeera live <div width="60%"> * al jazeera children's channel aka jcc <div width="60%"> * al jazeera english <div width="60%"> * al jazeera documentary channel <div width="60%">
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first al jazeera channel was created in 1996
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was made possible with 150 million us$ from the emir of qatar sheikh hamad bin khalifa
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in april 1996 the bbc world channel which operated in arabic was shut down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this channel was partly owned by saudi arabia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of the journalists from this station started working with al jazeera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the channel started broadcasting at the end of 1996
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because al jazeera was available in the whole region via satellite it changed the television landscape of the region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before that people could only watch channels that were censored by the different states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: al jazeera brought a new level of freedom of speech in television to the middle east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: al jazeera has always shown controversy on many governments in the middle east for example saudi arabia kuwait bahrain and qatar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also was critical about syria's relationship with the lebanon and of the judiciary in egypt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example on january 27 1999 al jazeera had critics of the government of algeria on their live program el itidjah el mouakass arabic for the opposite direction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to stop people from watching this program in algeria the government of algeria cut the electricity in large parts of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at that time many people outside the middle east did not know about al jazeera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: those people who knew it said generally good things about al jazeera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of good reporting from the lebanese civil war in 2000-2001 al jazeera got even more viewers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it only became know worldwide after it broadcast statements from al quaeda leaders in 2001
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people think that people that live in the middle east are given little information and that what they get is biased toward the government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people in the arab world see al jazeera as a good and true of information
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some scholars use the word of contextual objectivity which means that al jazeera shows both sides of a story but still manages to be popular with the audience
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this it is probably the most watched news channel in the middle east
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more and more channels for example bbc and cnn are using material from al jazeera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first al jazeera can be watched all over the world with several different satellite and cable systems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the us al jazeera can be watched on dvb s on the galaxy 25 and 23 satellites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in europe northern africa and the middle east it can be received via dvb s on the astra and hot bird satellites
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in australia al jazeera can be watched via the optus c1 satellite and in the united kingdom it can be watched via sky and freesat
